resplendeo: <entryFree id="n41386" type="main" key="re_splende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-splendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine brightly; to glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be resplendent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fulvā resplendent fragmina harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 741</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:732" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 446</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 543" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">resplendet gloria Martis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respondeo: <entryFree id="n41387" type="main" key="re_sponde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spondĕo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41387.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in return</hi> for something else; <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">present in return.</hi> So, only in a few examples, the phrase par pari (<case>dat.</case>) respondere, <hi rend="ital">to return like for like</hi>: par pari respondes dicto, <hi rend="ital">you return tit for tat with your tongue</hi> (syn. refero), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 41</bibl>; cf.: istuc serva; et verbum verbo par pari ut respondeas, Ter Phorm. 1, 4, 35; and: <cit><quote lang="la">paria paribus respondimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: provide, si cui quid debetur, ut sit, unde par pari respondeatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that there be wherewithal to meet the demand</hi>, Atticus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 6</bibl>; cf. also under II. A. 1, the lusus verbb. with spondeo; and II. B. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n41387.1" n="II" level="1"> In a more general signification. </sense><sense id="n41387.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond</hi> (either to a question, or to any statement or remark, and either in a friendly or hostile signif.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra aliquem</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>). </sense><sense id="n41387.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n41387.4" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Aliud te rogo. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Aliud ergo nunc tibi respondeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 73</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius respondes, quam rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā legatione Papirius auditā ... respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille appellatus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 62, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 14, 2. — So usu. of an oral answer: tibi non rescribam, sed respondeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also of writing: epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his sermo oritur, respondet Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 28</bibl>: olli respondit rex Albaï Longaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> p. 2691</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 34 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cui orationi Caepionis ore respondit Aelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremae tuae paginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui opinioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam aequae postulationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:47 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 47 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā constantiā ad ea, quae quaesita erant, respondebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrabar me satis respondisse ad id quod quaesierat Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:39:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 39, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec absurde adversus utrosque respondisse visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus haec imperator respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— With <hi rend="ital">acc. of neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud respondere cogam,</quote> <trans><tr>to make answer to that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa contra patronos venuste testis saepe respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:24" default="NO">5, 7, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe, quid contra juvenis responderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 233</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondent, bello se et suos tutari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2</bibl>. 102 al. —Introducing a direct answer: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dixisset, Quid agis, Grani? respondit, Immo vero tu, Druse, quid agis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; id. <cb n="RESP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:5:21:12" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 5, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Inv. 1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Tusc. 5:19:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 56</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">impers. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam mihi responsum est, abeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 93</bibl>: quid nunc renunciem abs te responsum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic existimet: Responsum non dictum esse, quia laesit prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. prol. 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ejus et in senatu et in foro vel provisa prudenter vel acta constanter vel responsa acute ferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— In the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(haec) quam brevia responsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— In a lusus verbb. with spondeo: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sponden' tu istud? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Spondeo. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> At ego, tuum tibi advenisse filium, respondeo, <hi rend="ital">and in return I promise you</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">assure you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 119</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fideiussores, qui salvam rempublicam fore responderunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>promised</tr>, <tr>gave assurance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41387.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa et solitudines voci respondent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">respondent flebile ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 53</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">respondentia tympana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 175</bibl></cit>: urbes coloniarum respondebunt Catilinae tumulis silvestribus, <hi rend="ital">will give an answer to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will prove a match for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41387.7" n="a" level="4"> Of lawyers, priests, oracles, etc., <hi rend="ital">to give an opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris, num juris consultus (sit)? quasi quisquam sit, qui sibi hunc falsum de jure respondisse dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure consulentibus respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a like signif., also simply jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas respondendi juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civica jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consuluntur, minimo periculo respondentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 7</bibl>; and so very freq. of the jurists in the Digests; <cit><quote lang="la">v. responsum: pater Roscii ad haruspices retulit: qui responderunt, nihil illo puero clarius fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex prodigiis haruspices respondissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:24:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberantibus Pythia respondit, ut moenibus ligneis se munirent,</quote> <trans><tr>gave advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:section=11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumus seniores amici quiete respondere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41387.8" n="b" level="4"> Of the answering of a person summoned when his name is called; hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>: citatus neque respondit neque excusatus est, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cives, qui ad nomina non respondissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Romae non respondebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 36</bibl> (vadato, <case>dat.</case>, i.e. ei qui eum vadatus erat; v. vador); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:14" default="NO">41, 1, 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41387.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi> before a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi> an accusation, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi> a charge, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectus in exsilium Tubulus est nec respondere ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verrem alterā actione responsurum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo Epaminondam responsurum putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi (sc. paeon et herous) se offerent et respondebunt non vocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (with res se ostendent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ii, qui debent, non respondeant ad tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">podagra ad tempus (with venit ad horam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per menstrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41387.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To answer to; to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accord</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">correspond with</hi> a thing; constr. usually with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia omnibus paribus paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut horum auctoritatibus illorum orationi, qui dissentiunt, respondere posse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba verbis quasi demensa et paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">respondent extrema primis, media utrisque, omnia omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: (Aristoteles dicit) illam artem (sc. rhetoricam) quasi ex alterā parte respondere dialecticae, <hi rend="ital">that it corresponds to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forms the counterpart of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare alteram porticum quae Palatio responderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a locality: contra elata mari respondet Gnosia tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lies opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pachyni pulsata Ionio respondent saxa profundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:73" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi magnae curae, ut ita erudiatur (Lucullus), ut et patri et Caepioni nostro et tibi tam propinquo respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: satis Graecorum <pb n="1582" /> <cb n="RESP" /> gloriae responderunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua virtus opinioni hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna meis optatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seges votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Caesaris non responsura lacertis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor meritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne prior officio quisquam respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par fama labori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:641" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi respondent veteres in carmine vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:197 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 197 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam nemo speciosiorem producet, sed hominibus non respondet,</quote> <trans><tr>he does not pay his debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori amore respondere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to return it</tr>, <tr>repay it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinti fratris liberalitati subsidiis amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex vico ortus est, eam patriam intellegitur habere, cui reipublicae vicus ille respondet,</quote> <trans><tr>to which it belongs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In mal. part.: mulieribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere ad parentum speciem,</quote> <trans><tr>resemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformentur directiones, ut longitudines ad regulam et lineam, altitudines ad perpendiculum, anguli ad normam respondentes exigantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">structuram ad perpendiculum respondere oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non tota ad animum responderat (villa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spem eventus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papirio quoque brevi ad spem eventus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid non ex voluntate respondet, iram provocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum quocumque obvertimus oris, Res sibi respondent simili formā atque colore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>correspond</tr>, <tr>are reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 167</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera respondent in aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia raro verba belle respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: medicus aliquid oportet inveniat, quod non ubique fortasse, sed saepius tamen etiam respondeat, <hi rend="ital">may answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suitable</hi>, Cels. praef.—</sense><sense id="n41387.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta quando cum quarto responderint (sc. colono),</quote> <trans><tr>have returned</tr>, <tr>yielded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. with <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus cum est repetita cultu, magno fenore colono respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis, nisi praepingui solo, non respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">metalla plenius responsura fodienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspon-sum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi> (equally freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n41387.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">suis postulatis responsa exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec paucis diebus ex illius ad nostra responsa responsis intellegentur, quorsum evasura sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine responso legatos dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo ab nostris dato responso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum dedisti tantis de rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 39, § 85</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 5</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triste redditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre (ab aliquo),</quote> <trans><tr>to receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre (ab aliquo),</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum non fuit in eis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (acc. to II. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">an answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi> of a lawyer, priest, oracle, etc.; <hi rend="ital">an opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oracle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum responsumque ab eo (Crasso) verum magis, quam ad suam rem accommodatum abstulisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res judicatae, decreta, responsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">The responsa prudentium, or authoritative opinions of leading lawyers, were an important source of the Roman law,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit> Sandars ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicum responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">527</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus a Delphis Romam rediit, responsumque ex scripto recitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO">5, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 86</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">In eccl. Lat.: responsum Dei, ab angelo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mich. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
responsio: <entryFree id="n41388" type="main" key="re_sponsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>respondeo</etym>. <sense id="n41388.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply; a refutation</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. responsum): in quo erat accusatoris interpretatio indigna responsione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsio mollis frangit iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 15, 1</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 63</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41388.1" n="2" level="3"> In rhet.: sibi ipsi responsio, <hi rend="ital">a replying to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own</hi> <cb n="REST" /> <hi rend="ital">argument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:90" default="NO">9, 3, 90</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quasi ad interrogata sibi ipse respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
responsito: <entryFree id="n41389" type="main" key="re_sponsi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>respondeo, II. A. 2. a.</etym>; <sense id="n41389.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">of lawyers,</quote> <trans><tr>to give an answer</tr>, <tr>opinion</tr>, <tr>advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
responsive: <entryFree id="n41390" type="main" key="re_sponsi_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>respondeo</etym>, <sense id="n41390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">responsively</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Ped. ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:56:section=148" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Ped. ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
responsivus: <entryFree id="n41391" type="main" key="re_sponsi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">answering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">responsive</hi>: sententia, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Fig. Sent. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 18</bibl> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 574</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
responso: <entryFree id="n41392" type="main" key="re_sponso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to return an answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n41392.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quisquam responset, quando hasce aedes pultabit senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro me responsa tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num ancillae aut servi tibi Responsant?</quote> <trans><tr>answer you back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoritur clamor, ripaeque lacusque Responsant circa,</quote> <trans><tr>re-echo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 757</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:597" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 597</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:286" default="NO">4, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gallina malum responset dura palato,</quote> <trans><tr>ill suit his palate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsare cupidinibus, contemnere honores Fortis,</quote> <trans><tr>to withstand</tr>, <tr>resist</tr>, <tr>bid defiance to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae superbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus cenis opimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
responsor: <entryFree id="n41393" type="hapax" key="re_sponsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that answers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">replies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
responsoria: <entryFree id="n41394" type="main" key="re_sponso_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsōria</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repetitions in vocal worship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">responses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 3, 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
responsum: <entryFree id="n41395" type="main" key="re_sponsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. respondeo <sense id="n41395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
responsus: <entryFree id="n41396" type="main" key="re_sponsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of respondeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41397" type="main" key="re_sponsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsponsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>respondeo, II. B.</etym>. <sense id="n41397.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi> (opp. interrogatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:1:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 1, § 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41397.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Correspondence of parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
respublica: <entryFree id="n41398" type="main" key="respubli^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">respublĭca</orth>, v. res, II. K.</entryFree>
respuo: <entryFree id="n41399" type="main" key="re_spu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spit back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out; to discharge by spitting; to cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>, etc. (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n41399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam gustatus, quam cito id, quod valde dulce est, aspernatur ac respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas natura respuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen per cornum transit, at imber respuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 389</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem ab se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum ab se (opp. resorbere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1054" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1054</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:197" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 197</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 231</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenos cum sanguine (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:544" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisum cadaver (humus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:170" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas albas propter amaritudinem respuit palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respuit aqua limum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum interest repercussum illum (aëra) respuat an excipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respuens securis materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 484</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41399.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse; to dislike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disapprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not accept</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">reprobo, reicio, repudio): quae nisi respuis ex animo longeque remittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id dicat, quod omnium mentes aspernentur ac respuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio juris respuat hanc defensionem et pro nihilo putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aetas omne quod fieri non potest respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos et praesens et postera respuit aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo judex dicto moveatur quid respuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non respuit Caesar condicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris interdicta respuuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are spurned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod respuunt (aures) immutandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo civis est, qui vos non oculis fugiat, auribus respuat, animo aspernetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim qui respuant (consolationem), sed refert quo modo adhibeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:33:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 33, 79</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te tum audiret illorum? respuerent aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 61</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calcitrat, respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41399.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communium vocum respuens nimis ac fastidiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restagnatio: <entryFree id="n41400" type="main" key="re_stagna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstagnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restagno</etym>, <sense id="n41400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans><tr>a rising</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl></cit>. <cb n="REST" /></sense></entryFree>
restagno: <entryFree id="n41401" type="main" key="re_stagno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stagno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow;</hi> of bodies of water: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes restagnantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">restagnantis fecit maris unda paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:382" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 382</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:3" default="NO">8, 15, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the inundated place: <cit><quote lang="la">late is locus restagnat,</quote> <trans><tr>is overflowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arva palude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:752" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 752</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restauratio: <entryFree id="n41402" type="main" key="re_staura_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstaurātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restauro</etym>, <sense id="n41402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:5:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eremodicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
restaurator: <entryFree id="n41403" type="gloss" key="re_staura_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstaurātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renovator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 3, 297 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
restauro: <entryFree id="n41404" type="main" key="re_stauro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stauro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuild</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 9</bibl>, and 27, 21, instaurare is the better read.; v. Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. instauro, reficio, restituo, sarcio). </sense><sense id="n41404.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">restaurare theatrum igne fortuito haustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Veneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem iisdem tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinum statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 21, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41404.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi> (syn. redintegro): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:2" default="NO">3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:6" default="NO">20, 5, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">31, 3, 8: accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:29" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem obligationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:35" default="NO">9, 4, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restiarius: <entryFree id="n41405" type="gloss" key="resti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">restĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>restis</etym>, <sense id="n41405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ropemaker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 2201" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 2201</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
restibilio: <entryFree id="n41406" type="hapax" key="re_sti^bi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭbĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>restibilis</etym>, <sense id="n41406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reestablish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>: Teucrum regi sapsa res restibiliet, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 99 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
restibilis: <entryFree id="n41407" type="main" key="re_sti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stabilis; hence, that is made to stand again</etym>. <sense id="n41407.0" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in econom. lang.. <hi rend="ital">that is restored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">renewed</hi>: ager, <hi rend="ital">that is sown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tilled every year</hi> (opp. novalis, which lies fallow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl> and 3; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:4" default="NO">11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus restibilis facta,</quote> <trans><tr>flourishing again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 133</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst..</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">restĭbĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fallow land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41407.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunditas (mulierum),</quote> <trans><tr>new</tr>, <tr>fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resticula: <entryFree id="n41408" type="main" key="resti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">restĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>restis</etym>, <sense id="n41408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. p. 261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. Fragm. p. 261 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Orell.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resticulum: <entryFree id="n41409" type="spur" key="resti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">restĭcŭlum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, a false read. for reticulum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 12</bibl>.</entryFree>
restillo: <entryFree id="n41410" type="main" key="re_stillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop back; to fall back in drops.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n41410.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 287</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n41410.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (tuae litterae) mihi quiddam quasi animulae restillarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have instilled again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> dub. (B. and K. stillarunt).</sense></entryFree>
restinctio: <entryFree id="n41411" type="hapax" key="re_stinctio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstinctio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restinguo</etym>, <sense id="n41411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quenching</hi> (of thirst): <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas ipsius retinctionis in motu est (after restincta siti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restinctus: <entryFree id="n41412" type="main" key="re_stinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of restinguo.</entryFree>
restinguo: <entryFree id="n41413" type="main" key="re_stinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stinguo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extinguish</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem restinguunt aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit> (with refrigerare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 12, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20</bibl>, praef. 1, § 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 807 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1087" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1087</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23</bibl>: incendium, Catil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 9</bibl>; id ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">restincto aggere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes accensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favillas ardentes lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:413" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 11, 413</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnis ex castris multitudo ad restinguendum concurreret,</quote> <trans><tr>to extinguish the flames</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ad restinguendum ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes restinguere velle videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41413.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to quench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counteract</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula ardentis Falerni lymphā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:158" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 10, 45, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:76" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 23, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus scorpionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 29, § 45</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41413.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exterminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum igitur tibi aquae erit cupido, genus qui restinguas tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustas sanguisugas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to kill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 17, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilos spumā inlitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 77</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1583" /> <cb n="REST" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">252: morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nauseam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba una mehercle falsa lacrimula Restinguet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam Ut ne restinguas lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hominum sensusque morte restingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes inflammatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 219</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum restinctum (opp. inflammatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriens incendium belli sanguine suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium cupiditatum ardorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illā tertiā parte animi, in quā irarum exsistit ardor, sedatā atque restinctā,</quote> <trans><tr>appeased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates iracundiasque (eloquentiā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermunculum omnem aut restinxerit aut sedarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentem Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:619" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies restinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:576" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 576</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restio: <entryFree id="n41414" type="main" key="resti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">restĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>restis</etym>. <sense id="n41414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ropemaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope-seller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 2201" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 2201</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n41414.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a comic lusus verbb., with bucaeda, for <hi rend="ital">one who is scourged with ropes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n41414.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a poem by Laberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restipulatio: <entryFree id="n41415" type="main" key="re_sti^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restipulor</etym>, <sense id="n41415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counter-engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counter-obligation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 37 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:18, p. 259" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 18, p. 259</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
restipulor: <entryFree id="n41416" type="main" key="re_sti^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stĭpŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n41416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stipulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">engage in return</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">recipio, despondeo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 338, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restis: <entryFree id="n41417" type="main" key="restis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">restis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> more freq. restim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 5</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109</bibl>: <sense id="n41417.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">restem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:70:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 70, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 715, 10</bibl>; but <case>abl.</case> usually reste, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:274" default="NO">14, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:62:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 62, 6</bibl>: resti, Don. 2, 10, 3, p. 1751; Rhem. Palaem. p. 1374 P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n41417.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">funis, rudens): quae fiunt de cannabi, lino, etc.... ut funes, restes, tegetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere hodie tu restibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restim volo mihi emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper remitte restem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsolvi restim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendunt statuae restemque sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem Illā reste cavet, of a rope-dancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:226" default="NO">3, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:70:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 70, 1</bibl>.—In a game of the Roman youth, the rows of dancers were united by taking hold of a rope (or, acc. to Donatus ad loc., they formed a line by taking hold of hands): <cit><quote lang="la">tu inter eas restim ductans saltabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: in foro pompa constitit; <cit><quote lang="la">et per manus reste datā, virgines sonum vocis pulsu pedum modulantes incesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak.—Prov.: ad restim res rediit, <hi rend="ital">it has come to the rope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one might as well hang himself</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinctus restibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41417.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: restes allii, caepis, <hi rend="ital">the leaves of garlic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">onions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restito: <entryFree id="n41418" type="main" key="re_sti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n41418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [resto], <hi rend="ital">to stay behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to loiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitate</hi> (ante-class., and several times in Liv. and Pliny the Elder): restitant, occurrunt, obstant, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 10</bibl> (Sat. 5 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">me miserum restitando reddiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim restitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Drak.; 10, 19; 30, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 19, § 50</bibl>: Menelaus me objurgat? id meis rebus regimen restitat, Enn. ap. Rufin. Fig. § 11, p. 205 Ruhnk. (Trag. v. 264 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
restitrix: <entryFree id="n41419" type="hapax" key="re_sti^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resisto</etym>, <sense id="n41419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that stays behind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic restitrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restituo: <entryFree id="n41420" type="main" key="re_sti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n41420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set up again</hi>, i. e. either <hi rend="ital">to replace</hi> in its former position, or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi> to its former condition, <hi rend="ital">to rebuild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.;
