syn.: restauro, renovo, reficio). </sense><sense id="n41420.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n41420.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus decrevit, ut Minerva nostra, quam turbo dejecerat, restitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxatum femur ex toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>: aedes (with reficere),<cb n="REST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum a Clodio disjectam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to rebuild</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas (disjectas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaea disjecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores effractas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida vicosque, quos incenderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes et Flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatas comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eos, qui) quaedam contra naturam depravata habent, restituere et corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos (luminibus orbati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 50, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (apes, with reviviscere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a limine mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 223</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and restinctos,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes restituunt se ac reviviscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41420.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reform</hi>, etc.: unus homo nobis cunctando restituit rem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 846</bibl> Serv.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:242" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 242</bibl>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21 al.</bibl> (Ann. v. 313 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem prolapsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res perditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem impeditam et perditam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> Drak.; 8, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">25, 37: veteres clientelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem tuam illam calliditatem atque prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciam potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciam intercessionem armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: proelium, <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam omnibus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna Romano accepta bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 56</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentem corruptum,</quote> <trans><tr>to reform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum a pudore maritimae ignominiae restituti animi,</quote> <trans><tr>restored</tr>, <tr>revived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolando aliquorum restituere voluntatem aut benevolentiam in dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41420.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> a thing belonging to a person or place (syn. reddo). </sense><sense id="n41420.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Paterna oportet reddi filio bona. <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Restituentur omnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni vobis amissa reddent ac restituent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With a personal object: virginem suis Restituere ac reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissa cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona iis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum locum huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Veientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui suum familiarem et hospitem, ereptum e manibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextus Pompeius civitati restitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captum victori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apibus fructum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris imperio restituendus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum restituam huic, hic autem in Alidem me meo patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem natalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to set free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40</bibl></cit>, tit. 11; <cit><quote lang="la">v. natalis.— With abstr. object: sed etiam meam vocem et auctoritatem et vobis et rei publicae conservatam ac restitutam puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem salutemque redditam sibi ac restitutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 28, 75</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissa (opp. adimere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arpi restituti ad Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cloelia) sospites omnes Romam ad propinquos restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:49" default="NO" valid="yes">49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Siciliam) in antiquum statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates afflictas in melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41420.6" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' and jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> to his previous state or condition; <hi rend="ital">to recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reinstate</hi> a person condemned, banished, deprived of his property, etc. (cf. reduco): <cit><quote lang="la">restituebat multos calamitosos ... Licinium Denticulam de aleā condemnatum restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, qui lege Pompeiā condemnati essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fuisset justa causa restituendi mei, nisi fuisset injusta eiciendi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (damnatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem totam cum ignominiā missam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim praetor, si ex eo fundo essem dejectus, ita me restitui jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23</bibl>: nonnullos ambitus Pompeiā lege damnatos in integrum restituit, Caes. <cb n="REST" /> B. C. 3, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:15" default="NO">4, 15</bibl> (cf. the whole section, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 1</bibl>: De in integrum restitutionibus); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sampsiceramum restitui in eum locum cupere, ex quo decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romanos in tribunicium honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos plebis in suam dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restitutus in patriam (Camillus) patriam ipsam restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41420.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41420.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to deliver up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make restitution of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utriusque bonis nihil erat, quod restitui posset, nisi quod moveri loco non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:12:1:section=19 al" default="NO">43, 12, 1, § 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41420.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of a previous judicial sentence or of injustice committed, <hi rend="ital">to reverse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make null and void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make good again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rescindo, resolvo): alia judicia Lilybaei, alia Agrigenti, alia Panhormi restituta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (praetor) dies totos aut vim fieri vetat aut restitui factam jubet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si ego eum condemnaro, tu restituas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">restitui in integrum aequom est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41420.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To compensate for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make good</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41420.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restore to a former condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to re-establish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anno XVI. post reges exactos secederent, leges sacratas ipsi sibi restituerent,</quote> <trans><tr>restored for themselves</tr>, <tr>re-established</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1</bibl></cit>, Fragm. 23, p. 450 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">restituit his animos parva una res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interfecto Punico praesidio restituerent se Romanis,</quote> <trans><tr>join themselves again to the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera sanitati restituens,</quote> <trans><tr>restoring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus peccasse fatentem Restituit,</quote> <trans><tr>restored to his former condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 135</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum semel occideris ... Non, Torquate, genus, non te facundia, non te Restituet pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituam jam ego te in gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud facile te in eundem rursus restitues locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 108</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cives ex servitute in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtam in locum, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 13: aliquem rursus in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem in antiquum locum gratiae et honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem (sc. in gratiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acarnanas in antiquam formulam jurisque ac dicionis eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos in amicitiam societatemque nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praecipitata raptim consilia neque revocari neque in integrum restitui possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiae veteri (Britanniam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restitutio: <entryFree id="n41421" type="main" key="re_sti^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restituo</etym>, <sense id="n41421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restoration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41421.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus incendio absumptae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a rebuilding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis in majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictarum civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis pristinae fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41421.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41421.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A giving back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restitution</hi> (in jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:1:section=14" default="NO">36, 1, 1, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:6:section=3" default="NO">36, 1, 6, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41421.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The act of replacing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reinstating</hi> one condemned or proscribed in his former condition; <hi rend="ital">the restoration of rights which have been forfeited by law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus restitutioque,</quote> <trans><tr>a recalling from exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:60" default="NO">60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in integrum restitutiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (v. this entire section: De in integrum restitutionibus); 4, 4, 18, § 1; 4, 4, 20 pr.</sense></entryFree>
restitutor: <entryFree id="n41422" type="main" key="re_sti^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuilder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41422.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41422.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 43</bibl> and 61: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. ad Constant. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti operis restitutor deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herm. Trism. p. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restitutorius: <entryFree id="n41423" type="main" key="re_sti^tu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n41423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to restitution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restitutory</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:46" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in restitutorio agendo (i. e. judicio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:6:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restitutrix: <entryFree id="n41424" type="main" key="re_sti^tu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>restitutor</etym>, <sense id="n41424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that gives back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium generum, quae accipit (terra, with receptrix),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 77, 31</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1584" /> <cb n="REST" /></sense></entryFree>
restitutus: <entryFree id="n41425" type="main" key="re_sti^tu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of restituo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41426" type="main" key="Resti^tu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Restĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Claudius Restitutus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Pliny the younger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resto: <entryFree id="n41427" type="main" key="re_sto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-sto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 1</itype> (<sense id="n41427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> restaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 53</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n41427.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stop behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand still</hi> (very rare and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, whereas resisto is class.). </sense><sense id="n41427.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: si resto, pergit, ut eam: si ire conor, prohibet betere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 77, 25</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41427.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: impetus haut longe mediis regionibus restat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=285" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 285</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 475 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullo dominae teritur molimine amator Restat et immerita sustinet aure minas,</quote> <trans><tr>stands firm</tr>, <tr>holds out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 18. — </sense><sense id="n41427.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi> (so less freq. than resisto, and not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n41427.5" n="A" level="2"> Of military resistance, <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not yield;</hi> constr. usually <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> rarely with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi>: Illyrii restant sicis sibinisque fodantes, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 496 Vahl.): validam urbem multos dies restantem pugnando vicit, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 526, 12</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 75</bibl> Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">quia summā vi restare (milites) nunciabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">solā virtute militum restantes caeduntur caeduntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 39</bibl>; 23, 45; 26, 3; 29, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">34, 14: dum restat Hector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in restantes mucronem comminus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quā minimā vi restatur, eā parte irrumpat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis plures vix restatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restando adversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 125</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum morae attulere ferrati restantibus laminis adversum pila et gladios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41427.6" n="B" level="2"> Apart from milit. lang., in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ratio nulla est restandi, nulla facultas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is mihi, dum resto, juvenili guttura pugno Rupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 626</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 411</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā re nunc tam confidenter restas, stulta?</quote> <trans><tr>oppose me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 50</bibl>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aera claustris restantia vociferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restantia claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:130" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 130</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41427.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi> (syn. remaneo; the predominant signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in the third person): hujus generis reliquias Restare video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego conviviis delector nec cum aequalibus solum qui pauci jam admodum restant, sed cum vestrā etiam aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vivendo vici mea fata, superstes Restarem ut genitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bonis quod restat reliquiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam sibi spem reliquam in Etruscis restare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. 45, p. 268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. Fragm. 45, p. 268</bibl> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (studia) sola ei in malis restiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes composui. Felices! Nunc ego resto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:97" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de viginti Restabam solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam labor exiguus Phoebo restabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae restant noctes de mense secundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:857" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si e nobis aliquid nisi umbra restat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam duo restabant fata tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui e divisione tripartitā duas partes absolverit, huic necesse est restare tertiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitae caedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: dona ferens pelago et flammis restantia Trojae, <hi rend="ital">left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remaining from the sea</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 679</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum etiam restat amico nostro ad omne dedecus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc unum restabat, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 471</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud etiam restiterat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9, 33</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restat, ut aut summa neglegentia tibi obstiterit, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">restat, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 27 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud restabat quam corrigere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restabat aliud nihil, nisi oculos pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 700</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 40</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41427.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with reference to the future, <hi rend="ital">to remain for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">await</hi> one (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid restat, nisi porro ut fiam miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet (vobis) socios sic tractari, quod restat, ut per haec tempora tractatos videtis?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hereafter</tr>, <tr>for the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus humi jacet infans ... ut aequom est, cui tantum in vitā restet transire malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Latio restare canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 270</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:749" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 749</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restricte: <entryFree id="n41428" type="main" key="re_stricte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. restringo, <sense id="n41428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> <cb n="RESU" /></sense></entryFree>
restrictim: <entryFree id="n41429" type="hapax" key="re_strictim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>restringo</etym>, <sense id="n41429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>: restrictim cogitata, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
restrictio: <entryFree id="n41430" type="main" key="re_stricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restriction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limitation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. Cath. 31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. Cath. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
restrictus: <entryFree id="n41431" type="main" key="re_strictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of restringo.</entryFree>
restringo: <entryFree id="n41432" type="main" key="re_stringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstringo</orth>, <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41432.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw back tightly; to bind back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tighten</hi>, etc. (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> not anteAug., but in the <pos>P. a.</pos> class.; syn. religo). </sense><sense id="n41432.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restrictis ad terga manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">restringitur vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">si manus manicis restringantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 17, p. 357, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Prometheus quondam silici restrictus membra catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclo fasciae in modum laquei restricto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41432.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, etc. (syn. retineo): <cit><quote lang="la">homines ad custodiam pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus candidatorum ambitūs lege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicias frugalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum maestitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus phalangiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 97, § 154</bibl></cit> (Jahn, restinguit): <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitationem nimbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 61, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41432.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dentes restringere,</quote> <trans><tr>to show the teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of dogs: rabie restrictā minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1065" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1065</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restrictis forte si labellis riseris, App. poët. Mag. p. 277: restrictis labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">bound fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41432.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">togis neque restrictis neque fusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 28, 519</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp..</hi> restrictiores digiti (pedum), i. e. <hi rend="ital">shorter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41432.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41432.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stingy</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parcus, tenax): in aliquo esse restrictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 22, 54</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41432.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an restrictius arbitraris per orbem terrarum legendum dare memoriam suam, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41432.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stringent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum imperium non restrictum nec perseverum volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 364, 39</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: restrictissimis regulis, Cod. 1, 17 (2), 10.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēstrictē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n41432.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere (with parce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Constant. 15</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restrictius uti rebus praetereuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restrictissime facere (opp. plenissime),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41432.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Strictly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera non tam restricte praefinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restricte tenent illud nomen (sapientium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observare, ne plus reddat quam acceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> prob. not found.</sense></entryFree>
restruo: <entryFree id="n41433" type="main" key="re_stru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to erect again</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n41433.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas dejectas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41433.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus eam restruebat fidem, quam populus destruebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resudatio: <entryFree id="n41434" type="main" key="re^su_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resudo</etym>, <sense id="n41434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exudation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. 79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resudo: <entryFree id="n41435" type="main" key="re^su_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sūdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweat out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exude</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n41435.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:3" default="NO">7, 10, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41435.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeriem ventris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 787</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 10, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resulco: <entryFree id="n41436" type="main" key="re^sulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plough again</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): vulnera, <hi rend="ital">to scratch open</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 5, 141.</sense></entryFree>
resultatio: <entryFree id="n41437" type="main" key="re^sulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resulto</etym>, <sense id="n41437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reverberation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata et consona, Ambros. Hexaëm. 3, 5, 11: laetitiae, id. in Psa. praef. § 9: blanda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41437.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resultator: <entryFree id="n41438" type="main" key="re^sulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who resists</hi> or <hi rend="ital">denies</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 9, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resulto: <entryFree id="n41439" type="main" key="re^sulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsulto</orth>, no <sense id="n41439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [resilio], <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leap back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rebound</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; only of inanimate or abstract subjects). </sense><sense id="n41439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) conflicta resultant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 98</bibl></cit> and 101: <cit><quote lang="la">tela irrita galeā clipeoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua objectu lapillorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unda scissa, Petr. poët. Sat. 89, 2, 31: illisum caput scopulis resultat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1064" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1064</bibl></cit>.— Of animals: <cb n="RESU" /> resultabunt canes ululantibus lupis, Amm 31, 1, 2.—</sense><sense id="n41439.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of sound, <hi rend="ital">to reverberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi concava pulsu Saxa sonant vocisque offensa resultat imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica est (apibus) echo resultanti sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur in duris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 193</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41439.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places or things that return a sound, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsati colles clamore resultant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:714" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:73" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera percussis incudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:69:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 69, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parma pulsu umbonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resultantibus armis et tubis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resultantibus lituis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum (saxa),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41439.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of pronunciation, etc., <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hop</hi>: (verba) ne brevium (syllabarum) contexu resultent, <hi rend="ital">produce a jumping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jerking effect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps ac resultans (in oratione, opp. tardum et segne),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO">12, 10, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut barbara nomina Graecis versibus non resultent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are unfit for</tr>, <tr>unsuiled to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resum: <entryFree id="n41440" type="spur" key="re^sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sum</orth> = resideo, assumed as <sense id="n41440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> for the var. l. l. resit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 8, 14</bibl>, where B. and K. read residet; <cit><quote lang="la">and reesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58, § 143</bibl></cit>, B. and K. esset.</sense></entryFree>
resumo: <entryFree id="n41441" type="main" key="re^su_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sūmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi, mptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resume</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n41441.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (terra) gentes omnis peperit et resumit denuo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 64</bibl> Müll. (Epich. v. 4 Vahl. p. 168): <cit><quote lang="la">positas (tabellas) resumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum perlectum utique ex integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugillares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito elapsum baculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuscinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 76</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextas (opp. exuere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem caelestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:743" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 743</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41441.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: instat anhelanti prohibetque resumere vires, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 59</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:7:1" default="NO">24, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interruptum somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">resumpto spiritu recreatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen gentile (opp. deponere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum Vespasiani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationem per arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 79:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituta cultumque patrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates (with repetere sollemnia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotantem,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:18:105" default="NO">18, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:7:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 7, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resumptio: <entryFree id="n41442" type="main" key="re^sumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resumo</etym>, <sense id="n41442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recovery</hi> of a sick person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
resumptivus: <entryFree id="n41443" type="main" key="re^sumpti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsumptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restorative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:75" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyclus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resumptorius: <entryFree id="n41444" type="main" key="re^sumpto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsumptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restorative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
resumptus: <entryFree id="n41445" type="main" key="re^sumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsumptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from resumo.</entryFree>
resuo: <entryFree id="n41446" type="main" key="re^su^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. resutus.</entryFree>
resupino: <entryFree id="n41447" type="main" key="re^su^pi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sŭpīno</orth>, no <sense id="n41447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn back</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n41447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ad me accurrit, Pone apprehendit pallio, resupinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assurgentem ibi regem umbone resupinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares planā manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to bend back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla (turtures, cum bibunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput (aves bibentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvas,</quote> <trans><tr>to beat in</tr>, <tr>break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 51: resupinati cessantia tympana Galli, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> from drunkenness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 176</bibl> et saep.— In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviam amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 112</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">leones resupinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: rem, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 165, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tantopere te resupinet?</quote> <trans><tr>makes proud</tr>, <tr>puffs up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resupinus: <entryFree id="n41448" type="main" key="re^su^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with the face upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supine</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n41448.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: resupinum in caelo contueri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lying on</hi> <pb n="1585" /> <cb n="RETA" /> <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">face upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur equis curruque haeret resupinus inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eque tuo pendet resupino spiritus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacuit resupinus humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 121</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 324: hunc ego resupinum fudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 86</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">retro lentas tendo resupinus habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>bent back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:520" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 93</bibl></cit> et saep. — Of an arrogant gait or manner: (Niobe) mediam tulerat gressus resupina per urbem, <hi rend="ital">with head thrown back</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">proudly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 275</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Th. 9, 3, 6: si non resupini spectantesque tectum expectaverimus, quid obveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectat resupino sidera vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:44:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 44, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41448.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things <hi rend="ital">turned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bent back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elis,</quote> <trans><tr>spread out on a hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:237" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra lilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41448.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slothful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solvit, numquam ita resupinus est, ut facile suas pecunias jactet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resurgo: <entryFree id="n41449" type="main" key="re^surgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-surgo</orth>, <itype>surrexi, surrectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raise one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear again</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; once in Liv. with velut; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n41449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnat resurgere saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si resurgat centimanus Gyges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of convalescent persons: resurgam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.— Esp., <hi rend="ital">to rise again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise from the grave</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab inferis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 7, 22</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus arbor repente prociderat ac postero die eodem vestigio resurgens procera et latior virebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obruta cymba de mediis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbe lunaria cornua nono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>is rebuilt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41449.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. resisto): <cit><quote lang="la">cum res Romana velut resurgeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illic fas regna resurgere Trojae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 206</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: arma resurgentis Trojae (i.e. Romae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 47; <cit><quote lang="la">87 (53 M.): victa tamen vinces, eversaque Troja, resurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:523" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resurgens Saevit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 13</bibl></cit>;
