<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes in Africā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones resurgere in ultionem properent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum ceteri ita vicerint ut major instaurando bello resurgeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac ne tam longā quidem aetate, quae excidium ejus secuta est, resurrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resurgit verae virtutis fortior fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter si resurgat murus aëneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resurrectio: <entryFree id="n41450" type="main" key="re^surrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsurrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resurgo</etym>, in eccl. Lat., <sense id="n41450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rising again from the dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resurrection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 1</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 22, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominica (i. e. Domini),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 33, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resuscitatio: <entryFree id="n41451" type="main" key="re^susci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsuscĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resuscito</etym>, in eccl. Lat., <sense id="n41451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raising again from the dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resuscitation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resuscitator: <entryFree id="n41452" type="main" key="re^susci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsuscĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in eccl. Lat., <sense id="n41452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who raises again from the dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a resuscitator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resuscito: <entryFree id="n41453" type="main" key="re^susci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-suscĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41453.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rouse again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resuscitate</hi>, freq. in the Christian writers, of the resurrection of the dead, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 38</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 6, 136; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 6, 39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41453.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">positam iram,</quote> <trans><tr>to revive</tr>, <tr>resuscitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:27:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 27, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resutus: <entryFree id="n41454" type="hapax" key="re^su_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [suo], <sense id="n41454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ripped open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica ex utrāque parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retae: <entryFree id="n41455" type="gloss" key="re_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trees standing on the bank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the bed of a stream</hi>, acc. to Gabius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:17:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 17, 4</bibl>.— From this is said to come the verb retare, <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from obstructions</hi>, in an old edict: flumina retanda; v. Gell. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
retalio: <entryFree id="n41456" type="hapax" key="re^ta_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tālĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to retaliate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod imprudentiā factum est, retaliari per imprudentiam debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retango: <entryFree id="n41457" type="main" key="re^tango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tango</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem spongiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:156" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retardatio: <entryFree id="n41458" type="main" key="re^tarda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtardātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retardo</etym>, <sense id="n41458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hindering</hi>,<cb n="RETE" />  <hi rend="ital">delaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retarding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl> (with mora).— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retardo: <entryFree id="n41459" type="main" key="re^tardo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tardo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n41459.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retard</hi> (class.; a favorite word with Cic., esp. in the trop. signif.; syn. moror). </sense><sense id="n41459.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (stellarum vagarum) motus tum incitantur, tum retardantur, saepe etiam insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere devio per ignorantiam locorum retardati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina retardant equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves retinere ac retardare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instantia ora retardat Cuspide praetentā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te metuunt nuper Virgines nuptae, tua ne retardet Aura maritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inundationibus Tiberis retardatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum mensibus retardatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 156</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae res, quae ceteros remorari solent, non retardarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41459.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus hostium repressos esse intellegunt ac retardatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum, Auct. B. Afr. 68: illius animos atque impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritatem persequendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab alicujus tempore aut commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6</bibl></cit>. 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigranem Asiae minitantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo non aetas quemquam, non valetudo, non sexus retardavit, quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea te fortuna retardat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:478" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia retardat sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:609" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 609</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem (agrum) fruendum non modo non retardat, verum etiam invitat atque allectat senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41459.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo cursu (stella Saturni) multa mirabiliter efficiens, tum antecedendo, tum retardando, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retaxo: <entryFree id="n41460" type="hapax" key="re^taxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-taxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rete: <entryFree id="n41461" type="main" key="re_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<case>abl.</case> reti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; <sense id="n41461.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">more freq. rete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:11:3" default="NO">3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:29:section=130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, 29, § 130</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:371" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 371</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hal. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Octav. 412 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Octav. 412 al.</bibl>—Collat. form, <case>acc.</case> retem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta porticus sit rete cannabina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in retes meas incidisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl></cit> P.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 659</bibl> ib.— But the <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, which <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 759</bibl> P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 45</bibl> ib., assume, is very doubtful.—Other collat. forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-tĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">di/ktuon,</foreign> Gloss. Philox., and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 759</bibl> P.; Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:207" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 207</bibl>) [for srēte, from sero], <hi rend="ital">a net</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga, casses, sagena): in piscinam rete qui jaculum parat ... dum huc dum illuc reti eos impedit Pisces, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 14 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra rete aves sunt omne genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneolae quasi rete texunt, ut, si quid inhaeserit, conficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia ponere cervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 307</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tendere cervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 701</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:512" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 512</bibl></cit>; 8, 331; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere in retia pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:922" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendere, pandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1 al.</bibl></cit>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nimis apparent retia, vitat avis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 516</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41461.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare, and perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi>: tum retia nexit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rete nexisti nostro lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 37: <cit><quote lang="la">retibus amoris exire (with nodos Veneris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui albo rete aliena oppugnant bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retectus: <entryFree id="n41462" type="main" key="re^tectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of retego.</entryFree>
retego: <entryFree id="n41463" type="main" key="re^te^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41463.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To uncover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period; syn.: nudo, exuo). </sense><sense id="n41463.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">thecam nummariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(area) retecta,</quote> <trans><tr>unroofed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus scisso velamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput pallio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17, 3</bibl></cit>: caput, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum simul pectusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:101" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 830</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw open</tr>, <tr>make accessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum hiatu,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 357</bibl></cit> (with patere): <cb n="RETE" /> homo retectus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deprived of his shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 374</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retexit se umbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:109" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram retexit anima tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 47, 16</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Titan radiis retexerit orbem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shall make visible</tr>, <tr>show</tr>, <tr>reveal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retegente diem Lucifero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: rebus luce retectis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 461</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41463.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum domūs scelus omne retexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidi commenta animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa deūm Trojanaque fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharsalica damna (clara dies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 215</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41463.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cover again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam paleato luto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retendo: <entryFree id="n41464" type="main" key="re^tendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum, or sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to release from tension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unbend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi> (very rare; syn.: relaxo, resolvo). </sense><sense id="n41464.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentos arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>to unbend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 419</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 30</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus retentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus retensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41464.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ea quoque, quae sensu et animā carent, velut alternā quiete retenduntur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unbend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi> (shortly before, remissio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retensus: <entryFree id="n41465" type="main" key="re^tensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of retendo.</entryFree>
retentator: <entryFree id="n41466" type="hapax" key="re^tenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. retento</etym>, <sense id="n41466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a detainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retainer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retentatrix: <entryFree id="n41467" type="hapax" key="re^tenta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retentator</etym>, <sense id="n41467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that retains</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retentio: <entryFree id="n41468" type="main" key="re^tenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retineo</etym>, <sense id="n41468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeping back</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n41468.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A holding back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holding in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 25, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a withholding</hi>: assensionis (as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)poxh/</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 59</bibl>, and 2, 24, 78.— </sense><sense id="n41468.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A keeping back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retaining</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:79" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:19" default="NO">5, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:30" default="NO">10, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <trans><tr>retention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41468.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Preservation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintenance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not to forgive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retento: <entryFree id="n41469" type="main" key="re^tento1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold back firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n41469.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me retentas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 39</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admissos equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 434</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 586</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam, calones, sarcinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum a terris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hold apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste qui retentat sese tacitus, quo sit tutus,</quote> <trans><tr>restrains himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41469.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to suppress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:97" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41469.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold back from destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>: (mens divina) Quae penitus sensus hominum vitasque retentat, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 17.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41470" type="main" key="re^tento2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tento</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tempto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to try</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attempt again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reattempt</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">timide verba intermissa retentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:382" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referoque manus iterumque retento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H.10,11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium fatale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec audent ea retentare, quorum vitia retractando patescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: nec vana retentet spes Minyas, <hi rend="ital">move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affect again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:679" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 679</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe retentantem totas refringere vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 208</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retentor: <entryFree id="n41471" type="main" key="re^tentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>retineo</etym>, <sense id="n41471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that holds back; a detainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retainer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 343, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retentorius: <entryFree id="n41472" type="main" key="re^tento_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>retentor</etym>, <sense id="n41472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitted to hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">checking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restraining</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retentus: <entryFree id="n41473" type="main" key="re^tentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n41473.0" n="a" level="4"> <mood>Part.</mood> of retendo.—</sense><sense id="n41473.1" n="b" level="4"> <mood>Part.</mood> of retineo.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41474" type="hapax" key="re^tentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>retineo</etym>, <sense id="n41474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivosque imitata retentus (manūus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 438</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retergeo: <entryFree id="n41475" type="main" key="re^tergeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tergeo</orth>, <itype>si, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wipe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n41475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:107" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas ruderibus obrutas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retero: <entryFree id="n41476" type="main" key="re^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tĕro</orth>, v. retritus.</entryFree>
retexo: <entryFree id="n41477" type="main" key="re^texo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-texo</orth>, <itype>xui</itype> (retexi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 214</bibl> dub.), <itype>xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41477.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unravel</hi> what has been woven (class.). </sense><sense id="n41477.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi Penelope telam retexens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela retexta dolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41477.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <pb n="1586" /> <cb n="RETI" /> of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (corpora possunt) retexi,</quote> <trans><tr>be decomposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 529</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">umorem maris (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 267</bibl></cit>: luna quater plenum tenuata retexuit orbem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lessened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diminished again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 531</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41477.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverse</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">resolvo, rescindo): multa quaerendo reperiunt non modo ea, quae jam non possint ipsi dissolvere, sed etiam quibus ante exorsa et potius detexta prope retexantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiora (novi timores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius praeturam (opp. suam gerere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (dicta),</quote> <trans><tr>to take back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem meam,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter</tr>, <tr>change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum quaeque,</quote> <trans><tr>to revise</tr>, <tr>correct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retegens caelum terque ora retexens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniae textum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 313, 38</bibl></cit>: an, quod adulescens praestiti, id nunc commutem ac me ipse retexam? <hi rend="ital">and fashion myself anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metamorphose myself</hi>, Masius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41477.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To weave again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anew; to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not anteAug.). — <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">properata retexite fata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>call back to life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde retro redeunt, idemque retexitur ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 249</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 763</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41477.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oro, mater, ordine mihi singula retexe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retextus: <entryFree id="n41478" type="main" key="re^textus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of retexo.</entryFree>
rethibeo: <entryFree id="n41479" type="main" key="re^thi^beo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕthĭbeo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕthĭbĭtio</orth>, v. redhib-.</entryFree>
retia: <entryFree id="n41480" type="main" key="re_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. rete <sense id="n41480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retiaculum: <entryFree id="n41481" type="main" key="re_ti^a_culum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭāculum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. reticulum.</entryFree>
retiarius: <entryFree id="n41482" type="main" key="re_ti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rete</etym>, <sense id="n41482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fights with a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a net-fighter</hi> (a kind of gladiator, who endeavored to hold his adversary by throwing a net over his head), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2578</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4273</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 204</bibl> sqq.; v. Dict. of Antiq.; and cf. mirmillo.—Prov.: contra retiarium ferula, <hi rend="ital">to fight with feeble weapons against one well equipped</hi>, or, as we might say, <hi rend="ital">to parry a lance with a bodkin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2 praef" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
reticentia: <entryFree id="n41483" type="main" key="re^ti^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reticeo</etym>, <sense id="n41483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeping silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi> (rare but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quid taces? enicas me miserum tuā reticentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 94 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">posterorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a jurisconsultis etiam reticentiae poena est constituta (viz. as to a defect in a thing sold),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41483.1" n="II" level="1"> In rhetor.,= aposiopesis, <hi rend="ital">a pause in the midst of a speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:54" default="NO">9, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:57" default="NO">57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reticeo: <entryFree id="n41484" type="main" key="re^ti^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41484.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep silence</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sileo, obmutesco): cum Sulpicius reticuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Chelidone reticuit, quoad potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de utriusque vestrum errore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non placuit reticere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne retice, ne verere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de adversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut vinculis ori impositis reticentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 11</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra, quae reticet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelion,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Rufin. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41484.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> of a person asking something, <hi rend="ital">to keep silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refrain from answering</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc interroganti senatori, paeniteatne, etc. . . . si reticeam, superbus videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 9</bibl></cit> Drak.; 3, 41, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 357</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41484.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">silent; to keep secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. celo): nihil reticebo, quod sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 9, 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae audierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestros dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa linguae reticenda modestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 63</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticetur formula pacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 151</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me subterfugere voluisse reticendo nec obscurare dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭcenda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things to be kept secret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reticulatus: <entryFree id="n41485" type="main" key="re_ti^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reticulum</etym>, <sense id="n41485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made like a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">net-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reticulated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">structura parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctio concharum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reticulum: <entryFree id="n41486" type="main" key="re_ti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭ-cŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14</bibl>, <cb n="RETI" /> 32, § 59; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 38, 5</bibl> et saep.), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rete</etym>, <sense id="n41486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cloth made like a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a net-work bag</hi> for carrying or keeping any thing in, <hi rend="ital">a reticule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 60</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a fishing-net</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venari reticulo in medio mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a strainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 19, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a net used in playing ball</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 361</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a net-work cap</hi> for confining the hair, worn by women and effeminate men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 12</bibl>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for covering the mouth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">net-work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">for the covering of a vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora ex reticulo suspensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:15:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 15, § 12</bibl></cit>: aeneum, <hi rend="ital">brass lattice-work</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl> Müll.—In form retiaculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl>, Reg. 7, 17 al.; <hi rend="ital">the caul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">omentum covering the intestines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 29, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
reticulus: <entryFree id="n41487" type="main" key="re_ti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. reticulum <sense id="n41487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retifex: <entryFree id="n41488" type="main" key="re_ti^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rete-facio</etym>, <sense id="n41488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a netmaker</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Homil. Fragm. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retinaculum: <entryFree id="n41489" type="main" key="re^ti^na_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭnācŭlum</orth> (sync. retinaclum, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:147" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 147</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>retineo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n41489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which holds back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binds; a holdfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cable</hi> (only in <number>plur.</number>; but the <number>sing.</number> occurs as v. l. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 4</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n41489.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO">6, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 265</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 580</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 712</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41489.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita abrupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 28</bibl></cit> (p. 806 Oud.): <cit><quote lang="la">blanda morarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges, fundamenta libertatis et retinacula sempiterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinaculis temporis praestituti frenari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retinax: <entryFree id="n41490" type="hapax" key="re^ti^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holding back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retinens: <entryFree id="n41491" type="main" key="re^ti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of retineo.</entryFree>
retinentia: <entryFree id="n41492" type="main" key="re^ti^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retineo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n41492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a retaining in the memory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 851</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retineo: <entryFree id="n41493" type="main" key="re^ti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>teneo</etym>. <sense id="n41493.0" n="I" level="1"> (With the signif. of the <hi rend="ital">re</hi> predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not let go; to detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retain; to restrain</hi> (class.; cf. restringo). </sense><sense id="n41493.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Asta, abire hinc non sinam. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid nunc me retines? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens foras ego ire volo, me retines, revocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, malum, astas? Quin retines altrinsecus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te dexterā retinens manu Opsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: si magis vis, eam omittam. <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Nolo; <cit><quote lang="la">retine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retine me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium dimittit, Liscum retinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his fit initium retinendi Silii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; 7, 52; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ad urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 9: cohortes apud se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit Varro ad me, et quidem id tempus, ut retinendus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>when he must be kept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum tempestate retentus,</quote> <trans><tr>detained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre sunt retenti, quin oppidum irrumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi me, vi inquam, Plancius et complexu suo retinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi jam profecti sunt, retinebis homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">euntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vinclis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo retineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also infra, B.: armorum parte tertiā celatà atque in oppido retentā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves pro bonis Tarquiniorum ab Aristodemo retentae sunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum portantes naves tempestatibus retentas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep back</tr>, <tr>stop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:575" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 575</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faculas sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 27), 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injectā manu ferreā et retentā utrāque nave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor madidā veste retentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41493.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep within bounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, etc.: hoc servi esse officium reor, <cb n="RETO" /> retinere at salutem (erum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderantem cursum atque in suā potestate retinentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:566" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:474" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos sociorum in fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retineri nequeo quin dicam ea, quae promeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, A.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (varietas) vehementer animos hominum in legendo tuo scripto retinere possit . . . ordo ipse annalium mediocriter nos retinet,</quote> <trans><tr>binds</tr>, <tr>enchains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">(picus) Ore suo volucres vagas retinere solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua retenta metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinentibus vobis, erumperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41493.3" n="II" level="1"> (With the signif. of the verb predominant.) <hi rend="ital">To hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, etc. (freq. only since the class. per.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.; cf. obtineo). </sense><sense id="n41493.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: potius mansuetudine et innocentiā imperatoris provinciam quam vi militum aut benignitate deorum retentam atque conservatam esse, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces (Minerva),</quote> <trans><tr>to preserve</tr>, <tr>protect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id egit, ut amicos observantiā, rem parsimoniā retineret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere servareque amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summos cum infimis pari jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque virtutem qui habet virtute retinetur in vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 61</bibl></cit> B. and K.: fortunam citius reperias quam retineas, Publ. Syr. 168 Rib. —</sense><sense id="n41493.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinete (fidem), post factum ut laetemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimo jus augurum . . . rei publicae causā conservatum ac retentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinam virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 48, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium pristinae dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam (with colere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit> Beier; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatem in pastores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatem in amicitiā et fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc morem usque adhuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de finibus retentae defensaeque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatem retinere, iracundiam pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociam animi in vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam suae pristinae virtutis, tot secundissimorum proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa (aures),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 70</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Palaemo et Telamo et Plato dicerentur, retinuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 60</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41493.6" n="2" level="3"> Post-class. for memoriā retinere, <hi rend="ital">to keep in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ille Hasdrubal est, sive quis alius, non retineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">retineo me dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 92 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observant</hi> of any thing (class.; cf. tenax); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sui juris dignitatisque retinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium equestris juris et libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avitae nobilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seleuci conditoris (civitas),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>retaining his institutions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui moris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5</bibl></cit> et saep. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprietatum in verbis retinentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retinnio: <entryFree id="n41494" type="main" key="re^tinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ring again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: in vocibus nostrorum oratorum retinnit quiddam et resonat urbanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retiolum: <entryFree id="n41495" type="main" key="re_ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rete</etym>, <sense id="n41495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little net</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 109:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 109, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retis: <entryFree id="n41496" type="main" key="re_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. rete <sense id="n41496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retium: <entryFree id="n41497" type="gloss" key="re_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rētĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. rete <sense id="n41497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
reto: <entryFree id="n41498" type="main" key="re^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. ‡ retae.</entryFree>
retollo: <entryFree id="n41499" type="main" key="re^tollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take away again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos, Coripp. Johan. 2, 329: signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retono: <entryFree id="n41500" type="hapax" key="re^to^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tŏno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retonsus: <entryFree id="n41501" type="hapax" key="re^tonsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tondeo], <sense id="n41501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
