retorpesco: <entryFree id="n41502" type="main" key="re^torpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-torpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become torpid</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pristini sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
retorqueo: <entryFree id="n41503" type="main" key="re^torque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend back; to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast back</hi> (class.; cf. <pb n="1587" /> <cb n="RETR" /> reflecto). </sense><sense id="n41503.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in sua terga (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:715" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora ad os Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 163</bibl></cit>: oculos saepe ad hanc urbem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium oculos in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus retortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocis equi colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherae terga,</quote> <trans><tr>to wrap about</tr>, <tr>cast about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to crisp</tr>, <tr>frizzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litore violenter undas,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive back</tr>, <tr>repulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhoetum unguibus leonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela ab Euboïcis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to return by the same way</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phaen. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bysso retorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missilia in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me retorsisti (a morte),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 17:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 17, 18</bibl></cit>. — Mid.: ubi paulatim retorqueri agmen ad dextram conspexerunt, <hi rend="ital">to wheel around</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41503.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animum ad praeterita, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus in auctorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina in eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:14:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 14, § 6</bibl></cit>; and simply argumentum, <hi rend="ital">to retort upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s opponent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 360, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter</tr>, <tr>change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 841</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retorresco: <entryFree id="n41504" type="main" key="re^torresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-torresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to parch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:1" default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:4" default="NO">3, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retorride: <entryFree id="n41505" type="main" key="re^torri^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtorrĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. retorridus <sense id="n41505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retorridus: <entryFree id="n41506" type="main" key="re^torri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-torrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parched up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burned up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dried up</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n41506.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami platani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:86:18" default="NO">86, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus Mucii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 66:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retorrida et muscosa prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herba) spinis retorrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 97, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up</tr>, <tr>wizen</tr>, <tr>wrinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41506.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">detriti et retorridi ad litterarum disciplinas serius adeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu gravissimus et retorridus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gloomy</tr>, <tr>morose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallicanae mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 58</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtorrĭdē</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">dryly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retortus: <entryFree id="n41507" type="main" key="re^tortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of retorqueo.</entryFree>
retostus: <entryFree id="n41508" type="hapax" key="re^tostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tostus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [torreo], <sense id="n41508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retractatio: <entryFree id="n41509" type="main" key="re_^tracta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retracto</etym>. <sense id="n41509.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking in hand again; a retouching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correction;</hi> so only Retractationes, the title of a work of Augustine.—</sense><sense id="n41509.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Reconsideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum qui fuerunt retractatio non sine acerbitate quādam juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41509.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hesitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi> (only in connection with <hi rend="ital">sine</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā retractatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 25</bibl> (with dubitatio); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque retractatione morietur,</quote> <trans><tr>surely</tr>, <tr>certainly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retractator: <entryFree id="n41510" type="main" key="re_^tracta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refuser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 15</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
retractatus: <entryFree id="n41511" type="main" key="re_^tracta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n41511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi> of retracto.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41512" type="main" key="re_^tracta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>retracto</etym>, Tertullian; v. retractatio. <sense id="n41512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repetition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 7</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41512.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hesitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine retractatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retractio: <entryFree id="n41513" type="main" key="re_^tracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retraho</etym>. <sense id="n41513.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graduum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the breadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41513.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41513.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A diminishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum (opp. auctio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41513.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hesitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā retractione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retracto: <entryFree id="n41514" type="main" key="re_^tracto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-tracto</orth> (in many MSS. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trecto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41514.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take hold of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">handle again; to take in hand again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake anew</hi>, etc. (class.; esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n41514.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 694</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios, Petr. poët. 89, 61: vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manu sua vota (i. e. the image),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>to go over again</tr>, <tr>retouch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to look over again</tr>, <tr>examine again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras in bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:257" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41514.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of mental action, <hi rend="ital">to reconsider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revise</hi>, etc. (syn. recognosco): <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia, quae ad cultum deorum pertinerent, diligenter retractarent et tamquam relegerent, sunt dicti religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fata domus (with relegere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 569</bibl></cit>: locus orationis a me retractandus,<cb n="RETR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augemus dolorem retractando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desueta verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum deae memorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:370" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges retractavit,</quote> <trans><tr>revised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges (librum), sed retractatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina diligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceae munera neniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterā die retractatur,</quote> <trans><tr>the negotiation is renewed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41514.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To withdraw one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> from an act; <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be reluctant</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41514.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniet tempus et quidem celeriter et sive retractabis sive properabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius nunc vocari Icilium, nunc retractantem arripi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 49</bibl></cit> Drak.; 3, 52; 37, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quid jam, Turne, retractas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 889</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41514.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retract</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod dicta retractent Ignavi Aeneadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: largitiones factas ante aliquantum tempus retractari non oportet, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 111</bibl> (112).— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to detract from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>, = detrecto: <cit><quote lang="la">retractandi levandique ejus operis gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 3, 4</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">revised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrected</hi>: retractatius <foreign lang="greek">su/ntagma,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retractus: <entryFree id="n41515" type="main" key="re_^tractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of retraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41516" type="hapax" key="re_^tractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>retraho</etym>, <sense id="n41516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinae bellicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrado: <entryFree id="n41517" type="main" key="re_^tra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trādo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deliver up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:6" default="NO">19, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:58 al" default="NO">24, 3, 58 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
retraho: <entryFree id="n41518" type="main" key="re_^tra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41518.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw; to call back</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41518.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">me retrahis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 63</bibl> (in the last two passages with revocare); <cit><quote lang="la">10, 25: bos domitus et procurrentem (bovem) retrahit, et cunctantem producit,</quote> <trans><tr>holds back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: aliquem hinc, Lucceius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem in Africam (Scipio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fata trahunt retrahuntque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra intra penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">occulere aut retrahere aliquid (pecuniae),</quote> <trans><tr>to keep back</tr>, <tr>withhold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 14, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: (corpuscula complexa) inter se retrahuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servitutem retrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41518.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to drag back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi> a fugitive, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut retractus, non reversus, videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fugā, 47, 4: fugientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:13" default="NO">38, 10, 13</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, comically, of fugitive money,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. also infra, B.—</sense><sense id="n41518.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam poëta vetus poëtam non potest Retrahere ab studio,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>, <tr>remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebas ab interitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex magnis detrimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex viginti trecentisque millibus ad centum quinquaginta retraxit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he reduced them to one hundred and fifty thousand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep back</tr>, <tr>suppress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vires ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 79:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 3</bibl></cit>: noctes, to <hi rend="ital">shorten</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae splendorem suum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: genus ejusmodi calliditatis et calumniae retrahetur in odium judicis, <hi rend="ital">is drawn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">converted into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">results in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 39, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem nocturnae quietis ad spem haud dubiam retraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With reference to the signif. A. 2: illa (verba), quae jam majoribus nostris ademit oblivio fugitiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll. — </sense><sense id="n41518.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anew; to bring forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to light again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known again</hi> (so perh. only in Tac.). </sense><sense id="n41518.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Antistium Veterem absolutum adulterii increpitis judicibus ad dicendam majestatis causam retraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem postero die ad eosdem cruciatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Treviros in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n41518.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblitterata aerarii monimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiorem civitatis partem ad societatem Romanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">drawn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>: emporium <cb n="RETR" /> in intimo sinu Corinthiaco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in trorsus sinus maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">retractior a mari murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retractius paulo cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retracti introrsum oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>deep-set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrecto: <entryFree id="n41519" type="main" key="re_^trecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. retracto <sense id="n41519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retribuo: <entryFree id="n41520" type="main" key="re_^tri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi> (class., but freq. only in eccl. Lat.; syn. remuneror). </sense><sense id="n41520.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora retribuat rebus recreetque fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo pecuniam acceptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum quem meruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 32, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcunque aliud acceperis, potes cum libuit retribuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41520.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to repay</tr>, <tr>requite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retributionem gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 13, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retributio: <entryFree id="n41521" type="main" key="re_^tri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retribuo</etym>, <sense id="n41521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repayment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retribution</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mali pro bono, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 23: vitae aeternae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:136:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 136, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retributor: <entryFree id="n41522" type="main" key="re_^tri^bu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trĭbūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recompenser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retributer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia retributoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retricibus: <entryFree id="n41523" type="gloss" key="retricibus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">retricibus</orth> <itype>cum ait Cato, aquam eo nomine significat, quā horti irrigantur</itype>, Fest. pp. 282 and 283 Müll. (<sense id="n41523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a canal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aqueduct;</hi> perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">r(e/eqron, r(ei=qron</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
retrimentum: <entryFree id="n41524" type="main" key="re_^tri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n41524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sediment</hi> of pressed olives, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of metals,</quote> <trans><tr>dross</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 26</bibl>; of food and drink, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi> (i. e. excrement, urine), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retrituro: <entryFree id="n41525" type="main" key="re_^tri_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trītūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thresh over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thresh</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Macr. 255:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Macr. 255, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retritus: <entryFree id="n41526" type="hapax" key="re_^tri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worn down</hi>: rutabulum, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">retritis pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retro: <entryFree id="n41527" type="main" key="re_^tro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from re and the pronominal suffix ter, as in citro, ultro, intro, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n41527.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back; on the back side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41527.1" n="a" level="4"> Denoting tendency, direction, with verbs or nouns of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">multa videbis retro repulsa revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 130</bibl></cit>; so very often with redire, regredi, repetere, remittere, respicere, reverti, revocare, etc., v. h. vv., and cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6, 7</bibl>, and 27, 28, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia retro sequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 753</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 392</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 405</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare lintea retro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora retro Flectit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro inhibitā nave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: iter mihi retro ad Alpes versus incidit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam retro spectante milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugit retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne currente retro funis eat rotā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix retro Perjura cedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde ad hunc orbem redii, unde retro nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 48" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41527.2" n="b" level="4"> Denoting rest (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi in ultimis conclave aedibus quoddam retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid retro atque a tergo fieret, ne laboraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perculsis nullum retro subsidium foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro Marsigni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MEMORIAM SE VIVA FECIT SIBI ... CVM AEDICVLIS ANTE ET A RETRO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4512</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41527.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41527.4" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">back; in time back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in past times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et deinceps retro usque ad Romulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">SVPER OMNES RETRO PRINCIPES FORTISSIMO IMP. CAES., etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1049</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so, OMNES RETRO PRINCIPES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1098</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque retro est,</quote> <trans><tr>is past</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemissa retro nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:68" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 118</bibl> (120): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus vim si retro quoque velimus custodire (opp. in futurum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 115</bibl></cit> (116) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliorum retro principum ( = superiorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id ab aliis retro factum recordarer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Uxor. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebraei retro, qui nunc Judaei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41527.5" n="B" level="2"> In other relations, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice versa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imā (voce) ad summam ac retro multi sunt gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia, quae sine eā (honestate) sint, longe retro ponenda censeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursum versus retroque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vide rursus retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: sic omnia fatis In pejus ruere, ac retro sublapsa referri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">against one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s efforts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1</bibl>, <pb n="1588" /> <cb n="RETR" /> 200; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">retro vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malum perfidia, non est fallendum. Idem retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus hominis in operis consistit et retro in fructu hominis operae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:67" default="NO">46, 3, 67</bibl> et saep.?*! The words containing retro in composition (except retroversus and retrorsus) are post-Aug.; they are sometimes written separately.</sense></entryFree>
retroago: <entryFree id="n41528" type="main" key="re_^tro^a^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trŏ-ăgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, etc. (post - Aug.; esp. freq. in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n41528.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos a fronte contra naturam,</quote> <trans><tr>to push back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41528.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 145</bibl></cit>: rursus litteras (opp. recto contextu), <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeat backwards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to reverse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (dactylo) temporibus parem sed retroactum, appellari constat anapaeston,</quote> <trans><tr>reversed</tr>, <tr>inverted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrocedo: <entryFree id="n41529" type="main" key="re_^tro_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-cēdo</orth> (or separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^tro cēdo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 9</bibl> (Weissenb. retro cedentes); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:4" default="NO">7, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retrocessio: <entryFree id="n41530" type="main" key="retro_cessio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">retrōcessio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = retrocessus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quant. Anim. 37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quant. Anim. 37</bibl>.</entryFree>
retrocessus: <entryFree id="n41531" type="main" key="re_^tro_cessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-cessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cedo</etym>, <sense id="n41531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrocession</hi> (opp. processus), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
retroduco: <entryFree id="n41532" type="main" key="retro_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">retrō-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retroeo: <entryFree id="n41533" type="main" key="re_^tro^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trŏ-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retroflecto: <entryFree id="n41534" type="main" key="re_^tro_flecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-flecto</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn back</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrogradatio: <entryFree id="n41535" type="main" key="re_^tro_gra^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgrădātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>retrogradior</etym>, <sense id="n41535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrograding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 881</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, p. 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrogradior: <entryFree id="n41536" type="main" key="re_^tro_gra^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-grădĭor</orth>, <itype>di</itype>, <sense id="n41536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgrădo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 887</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to go back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retrograde</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the retrograde motion of the stars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 14, § 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 883</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retrogradis: <entryFree id="n41537" type="hapax" key="re_^tro_gra^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgrădis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. retrogradus <sense id="n41537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retrogrado: <entryFree id="n41538" type="main" key="re_^tro_gra^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgrădo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. retrogradior <sense id="n41538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
retrogradus: <entryFree id="n41539" type="main" key="re_^tro_gra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgrădus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trōgrădis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>retrogradior</etym>, <sense id="n41539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrograde;</hi> usually of the stars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>: carmen retrogradum (i. e. reciprocum), Aug. Civ. Dei, 17, 15: retrogradis fuga, App. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
retrogressus: <entryFree id="n41540" type="main" key="re_^tro_gressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a retrograde movement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrogression</hi> of the sun (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
retropendulus: <entryFree id="n41541" type="hapax" key="re_^tro_pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-pendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinium globi (opp. antependuli),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrorsum: <entryFree id="n41542" type="main" key="re_^tro_rsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsus</orth>, v. retroversus.</entryFree>
retrosior: <entryFree id="n41543" type="main" key="re_^tro_si^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōsĭor</orth>, v. retroversus, B.</entryFree>
retrospicio: <entryFree id="n41544" type="main" key="re_^tro_spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>specio</etym>, <sense id="n41544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look back at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem lunae (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retroversim: <entryFree id="n41545" type="hapax" key="re_^tro_versim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōversim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>retroversus</etym>, <sense id="n41545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedentes radii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retroversus: <entryFree id="n41546" type="main" key="re_^tro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trō-versus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-sum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-vorsus</orth>, and sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sum</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trōsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n41546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi> (<pos>adj.</pos> very rare, but freq. as <pos>adv.</pos>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n41546.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trōversus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medusae Ipse retroversus squalentia prodidit ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retroversi ortus omen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <trans><tr>confuted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41546.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">retrorsā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 9, 60, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique saepe retrorsa respiciens (mulier) substitit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 6</bibl></cit> Hild. p. 101 Oud. (retrorsus, p. 101 Elm.).—</sense><sense id="n41546.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, as to time, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier;</hi> so only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">retrosior,</quote> <trans><tr>older</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in four forms: retrorsum (the predom. one, class.), retrorsus, retrovorsum, and retroversus, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41546.4" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41546.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsum</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">me vestigia terrent, Omnia te adversum spectantia, nulla retrorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata te ferat aura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rejectae Hannibalis minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41546.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsus</orth>: dare terga metu, Val. <cb n="REUS" /> Fl. 3, 268: <cit><quote lang="la">cedentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:513" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 143, 39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41546.7" n="(g)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōvorsum</orth>: cedam, imitabor nepam, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 145, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41546.8" n="(d)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōversus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia crescit tamquam coda vituli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41546.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41546.10" n="a" level="4"> In time, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">retrorsus ad id tempus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retrorsum se actio refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41546.11" n="b" level="4"> In other relations, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in reversed order.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41546.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōr-sum</orth>: ex terrā aqua, ex aquā oritur aer, ex aëre aether; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde retrorsum vicissim ex aethere aër, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit> (cf. the like use of retro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 785</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut viros ac feminas, diem ac noctem dicas potius, quam retrorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:25" default="NO">7, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam et retrorsum idem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed omnia retrorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:25" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41546.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^trōrsus</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac si retrorsus homo mihi venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 3, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retrudo: <entryFree id="n41547" type="main" key="re_^tru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trūdo</orth>, no <sense id="n41547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust back</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi retruderet hominum me vis invitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metallum retrudendus, Cod. Th. 1, 5, 1: in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 41, 10</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-trūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed;</hi> several times in Cic. with abditus: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in philosophiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retundo: <entryFree id="n41548" type="main" key="re^tundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭdi</itype> (also rettŭdi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 21</bibl> Orell. <sense id="n41548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), tūsum (retunsus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 8</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pound back</hi> any thing sharp, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41548.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Massagetas ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios in rem publicam destrictos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascias (tilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamata tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis nefaria tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:24:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 24, 63</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41548.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(censorii stili) mucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem ingenii cotidianā pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl></cit> (with deteratur fulgor): belle iste puer retundit Antonium, Atticus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum, qui luxuriā et lasciviā Diffluit,</quote> <trans><tr>check</tr>, <tr>repress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">impetum erumpentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: sermones, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetolorum linguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31</bibl></cit>: improbitatem, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl> (with propulsare eos): <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas retundit pelagus (ira motum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 601</bibl></cit> Cort. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tūsus</orth> (retunsus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">blunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41548.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retusum et crassum ferramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum hebeti mucrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1274</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41548.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cor retunsum'st oppugnando pectore,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of feeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia (opp. acuta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella crine retuso,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>, <tr>dimmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen retusius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervor belli,</quote> <trans><tr>subdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:321" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>impaired</tr>, <tr>unfortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retunsus: <entryFree id="n41549" type="main" key="re^tunsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtunsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of retundo.</entryFree>
returo: <entryFree id="n41550" type="main" key="re^tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-tūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>turo, whence also obturo</etym>, <sense id="n41550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstop</hi> (only in the two foll. passages): obscenis verbis novae nuptae aures returare, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora coarticulare mutorum, surdorum auriculas returare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
retusus: <entryFree id="n41551" type="main" key="re^tu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕtūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of retundo.</entryFree>
reudigni: <entryFree id="n41552" type="main" key="Reudigni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Reudigni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gothic; root rinds, venerable</etym>, <sense id="n41552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the right bank of the Albis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of the Longobards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reunctor: <entryFree id="n41553" type="hapax" key="re^unctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-unctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ungo</etym>, <sense id="n41553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointer</hi> (a physician's assistant, who rubbed the patient with ointments), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reus: <entryFree id="n41554" type="main" key="re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>res</etym>, jurid. t. t. <sense id="n41554.0" n="I" level="1"> Originally, <hi rend="ital">a party to an action</hi> (res), either plaintiff or defendant; afterwards restricted to <hi rend="ital">the party accused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prisoner</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">reos appello non eos modo, qui arguuntur, sed omnes, quorum de re disceptatur. Sic enim olim loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reos appello, quorum res est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 79, 321</bibl></cit>: reus nunc dicitur, qui causam dicit: et <cb n="REVE" /> item qui quid promisit spoponditve ac debet. At Gallus Aelius, lib. II. Significationum verborum quae ad jus pertinent, ait: <cit><quote lang="la">reus est qui cum altero litem contestatam habet, sive is egit, sive cum eo actum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl></cit> Müll. It is found in this original signif. in the Lex XII. Tab., Fragm. ap. Fest. l. l., which Ulpian periphrases: <cit><quote lang="la">si judex vel alteruter ex litigatoribus morbo sontico impediatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41554.1" n="II" level="1"> In the stricter sense. </sense><sense id="n41554.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A party obliged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under obligation</hi> to do or pay any thing, <hi rend="ital">one answerable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">responsible</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">a bondsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a debtor</hi>: reus dictus est a re, quam promisit ac debet. Reus stipulando est, qui stipulatur. Reus promittendo est, qui suo nomine alteri quid pro altero promisit, Fest. pp. 135 and 227; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 2, 1</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">delegare est vice suā alium reum dare creditori vel cui jusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae reus fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:22:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 3, 22, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13:section=9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 13, § 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41554.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">one who is bound</hi> by any thing, <hi rend="ital">who is answerable</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">a debtor</hi> (very rare): quo intentius custodiae serventur, opportuna loca dividenda praefectis esse, ut suae quisque partis tutandae reus sit, <hi rend="ital">answerable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">responsible for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl>: voti reus, <hi rend="ital">bound by my vow</hi> (sc. in having obtained my desire), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 237</bibl> (voti reus, debitor, Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">voti reus: Haec vox propria sacrorum est, ut reus vocetur, qui suscepto voto se numinibus obligat, damnatus autem, qui promissa vota non solvit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl></cit>). — </sense><sense id="n41554.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who is accused</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arraigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a defendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a criminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">culprit</hi> (the predominant signif. at all periods and in all styles; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocens, sons): quis erat petitor? Fannius. Quis reus? Flavius. Quis judex? Cluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia reorum ... aliquos ad columnam Maeniam reos reperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privato Milone et reo ad populum accusante P. Clodio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus Milonis lege Plotiā fuit Clodius quoad vixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquem reum,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Persons under criminal charges usually put on mourning: rei ad populum Furius et Manlius circumeunt sordidati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl>). — In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut socrus adulescentis rea ne fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota rea citaretur Etruria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rea es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 29</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41554.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With a statement of the crime or the punishment, <hi rend="ital">one guilty</hi> of any crime, <hi rend="ital">one condemned</hi> to any punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">facti reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem rei capitalis reum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenocinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifesti peculatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sestius, qui est de vi reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim reus uterque ob eandem causam et eodem crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equester ordo reus a consulibus citaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15, 35</bibl></cit>. — For the expressions reum facere, agere, peragere, postulare, inter reos referre, etc., v. h. vv.— </sense><sense id="n41554.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">judex sim Reusque ad eam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>that was to be blamed for a misfortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>;
