<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus agor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 91</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna una accusatur, una agitur rea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rea laudis agar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revalesco: <entryFree id="n41555" type="main" key="re^va^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vălesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow well again; to regain one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s former strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">condition; to recover</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. for convalesco, reficior). </sense><sense id="n41555.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex capitali morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interibi revalesco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te significasti jam revalescere coepisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 79, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41555.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laodicea (tremore terrae prolapsa), revaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>: diplomata Othonis, quae neglegebantur, revalescerent, <hi rend="ital">regain their force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astutia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revecto: <entryFree id="n41556" type="main" key="re^vecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vecto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry back again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Macedoniam corpus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 3:42" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reveho: <entryFree id="n41557" type="main" key="re^ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to convey back</hi> (class.; syn.: <pb n="1589" /> <cb n="REVE" /> reporto, refero, reddo). </sense><sense id="n41557.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana Segestam Carthagine revecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praedam inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela ad Graios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domum (mater),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Promethea (satelles Orci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:734" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias Romam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revehunt vitrea, et aëna, vestis, fibulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 88</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41557.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, in mid. force, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">back; to return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis reveheretur inde ad proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo citato ad urbem revectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul revectus in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per circum ad foros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru triumphali revectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis est Ithacam revehi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ego sum raptis parte revectus equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41557.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam optimam ex Bithyniā revexisti,</quote> <trans><tr>brought back</tr>, <tr>brought home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad paulo superiorem aetatem revecti sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>have gone back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 63, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revelatio: <entryFree id="n41558" type="main" key="re^ve_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvēlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revelo</etym>, <sense id="n41558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an uncovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laying bare</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n41558.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudendorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 182</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41558.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginariae revelationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii sui,</quote> <trans><tr>a revelation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 7</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.,</quote> <trans><tr>the Revelation of St. John</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Inst. Epit. 42, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revelator: <entryFree id="n41559" type="main" key="re^ve_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvēlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a revealer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revelatorius: <entryFree id="n41560" type="main" key="re^ve_la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvēlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to revelation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revello: <entryFree id="n41561" type="main" key="re^vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vello</orth>, <itype>velli, vulsum or volsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pull away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41561.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascentis equi de fronte revolsus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulum de fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum altā ab radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput a cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 523</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu a fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum e monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:341" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem e monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:882" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a silvis silvas et ab arvis arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:584" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo morte revelli,</quote> <trans><tr>to be torn away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axem temone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 316</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudem osse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:300" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem manibus tellure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Sidoniā urbe,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear away</tr>, <tr>remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:515" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:273" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas radice,</quote> <trans><tr>with the root</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 226</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, annosam pinum solido trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:356" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam crucem, quae fixa est ad portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">112: Gorgonis os pulcherrimum revellit atque abstulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">124: gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua, quā effractā et revolsā, tota pateret provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene fores templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revulsis venis,</quote> <trans><tr>opened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 978" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 978</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites revincti, ne revelli possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximos agri terminos,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear away</tr>, <tr>remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa (when an army decamps),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:733" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 733</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo dente humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum sepulcra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem manesque,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>, <tr>violate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 427</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41561.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send away</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus totus consulatus est ex omni monumentorum memoriā revulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias honorificis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui avias veteres,</quote> <trans><tr>prejudices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsorum persuasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus de stirpe imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula fida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 57</bibl></cit> (with dissipat amplexus).</sense></entryFree>
revelo: <entryFree id="n41562" type="main" key="re^ve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unveil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay bare</hi> (not ante-Aug.; syn.: patefacio, aperio, nudo, retego). </sense><sense id="n41562.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput (opp. involvere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:71" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpenta (opp. contegere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 73</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41562.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes (with detegere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (tempus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam et salutem Domini cunctis gentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 28, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 10, 26</bibl> et saep.: Ulixes Eumaeo, quis sit, revelat. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Od. 21</bibl>. <cb n="REVE" /></sense></entryFree>
revendo: <entryFree id="n41563" type="main" key="re^vendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vendo</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭ, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sell again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operas liberto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reveneo: <entryFree id="n41564" type="main" key="re^ve_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vēnĕo</orth>, <itype>ii, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be sold again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fundus revenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revenio: <entryFree id="n41565" type="main" key="re^ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to return</hi> (class.; cf.: redeo, revertor). </sense><sense id="n41565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reveni, ut illum persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 181</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domum de hippodromo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:119 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 119 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex longinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41565.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">in eum nunc haec revenit res locum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo reveni ex inimicitiā in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eos rursum si reventum in gratiam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 61</bibl></cit> (a little before, redeunt rursum in gratiam).</sense></entryFree>
reventilo: <entryFree id="n41566" type="main" key="re^venti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-ventĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n41566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce again</hi>, = proferre: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil phantasiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revento: <entryFree id="n41567" type="spur" key="re^vento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. for reverto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1061</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</entryFree>
reventus: <entryFree id="n41568" type="main" key="re^ventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>revenio</etym>, <sense id="n41568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a return</hi>, Suevius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
revera: <entryFree id="n41569" type="main" key="re_ve_ra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēvērā</orth>, v. res, II. A.</entryFree>
reverbero: <entryFree id="n41570" type="main" key="re^verbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to rebound</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sic veneficiis corpus induruit, ut saxa reverberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indus saxis saepe impeditus quīs crebro reverberatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverberato lapide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut humus molliter cedat nec incrementa duritiā suā reverberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adeo ut radios omnis nostri tuoris splendore reverberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc vi reverberante ventorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41570.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1</bibl>. 27; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reverecunditer: <entryFree id="n41571" type="main" key="re^ve^re_cundi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĕrēcundĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n41571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">respectfully</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 180</bibl> Vahl.); Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 22</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 200 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
reverendus: <entryFree id="n41572" type="main" key="re^ve^rendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of revereor.</entryFree>
reverens: <entryFree id="n41573" type="main" key="re^ve^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of revereor.</entryFree>
reverenter: <entryFree id="n41574" type="main" key="re^ve^renter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>revereor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. <sense id="n41574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
reverentia: <entryFree id="n41575" type="main" key="re^ve^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revereor</etym>, <sense id="n41575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">timidity</hi> arising from high respect or (more rarely) from fear, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi> (not freq. till after the post-Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">adhibenda est quaedam reverentia adversus homines, et optimi cujusque et reliquorum: nam neglegere, quid de se quisque sentiat, non solum arrogantis est, sed omnino dissoluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:69:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla superiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:177" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum reverentia movit Saepe deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:510" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti et aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla poscendi, dandi,</quote> <trans><tr>shyness</tr>, <tr>shame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">discendi,</quote> <trans><tr>fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cuique personae debetur reverentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima debetur puero reverentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">judex tacitus reverentiam postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi reverentiā ut aequali habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam illa reverentiam marito suo praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi reverentiam praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 26</bibl></cit> (11), 1.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, etc.: ego reverentiae vestrae sic semper inserviam (for vestri), <hi rend="ital">the deference</hi> or <hi rend="ital">veneration due to you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your dignity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:95" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Reverentia, as a deity, <hi rend="ital">the mother of</hi> Majestas <hi rend="ital">by</hi> Honor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revereor: <entryFree id="n41576" type="main" key="re^ve^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĕrĕor</orth>, ĭtus. 2, <sense id="n41576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrĕo</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">to stand in awe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fear of; to regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor; to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid of; to reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.; syn. veneror): <hi rend="ital">Ap.</hi> Quid est quod pudendum siet, genere natam bono pauperem Ducere uxorem? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Revereor filium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl> (cf. infra, the passage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 3</bibl>): observantia, per quam aetate aut sapientiā aut honore ... antecedentis reveremur<cb n="REVE" />  et colimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (sc. oratores) ituri in provincias magistratus reverebantur, hos reversi colebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nigidium Cicero summe reveritus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—More freq. with inanim. or abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ejus opulentitatem reverearis,</quote> <trans><tr>stood in awe of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultatem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (also quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">adventum tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgorem ab auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam non reverens assentandi suspicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa adversa reverens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetum virorum (Tullia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam captivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem illustrium scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverearis occursum, non reformides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne revereatur, minus jam quo redeat domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quaestus quidem suos reveritus illos opimos, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>did not spare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 51, 72, § 142</bibl></cit>.—（*<foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> in analogy with pudet: non te tui saltem pudet, si nihil mei revereatur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 1</bibl>; cf. vereor. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n41576.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">respectful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regardful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo erga patrem imperatoremque reverens, de se moderatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: responsum parum reverens, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans><tr>bashful</tr>, <tr>modest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit> (3, 28), 33: <cit><quote lang="la">puella parentum suorum reverens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204, 21</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo reverentior leniorve erga senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis reverentior senatus candidatus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:69:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 69, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctius ac reverentius visum de actis deorum credere quam scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illnd modestius ac fortasse reverentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:66" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 66</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabium reverentissimum mei expertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 86</bibl></cit> (18), 1. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕrenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">respectfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 31, 5</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 21</bibl> (32) <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n41576.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvĕ-rendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">inspiring awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverend</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colen. dus, venerandus): nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:513" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacraria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas (libri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:11" default="NO">18, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: Reverendissimus, <hi rend="ital">most reverend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right reverend</hi>, a title of bishops, etc., Cod. Th 1, 55, 8; 1, 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
revergo: <entryFree id="n41577" type="main" key="re^vergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to incline towards</hi> any thing; trop.: in aliorum commoda, <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduce</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Ep. ad Sid. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reverro: <entryFree id="n41578" type="hapax" key="re^verro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-verro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕvorro</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweep back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scatter again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">revorram hercle hoc, quod convorri modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 27</bibl> and 51).</sense></entryFree>
reversio: <entryFree id="n41579" type="main" key="re^versi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕversĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕvors-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reverto</etym>. <sense id="n41579.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A turning back</hi> before reaching one's destination (differing from reditus, a coming back, return): <cit><quote lang="la">quam valde ille reditu vel potius reversione meă laetatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponam vobis breviter consilium et profectionis et reversionis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reversionem ut ad me faceret denuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Truo. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 62</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">245, 14</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41579.1" n="2" level="3"> Of things in gen., <hi rend="ital">a returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua (solis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 71, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">planetarum temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41579.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, gram. t. t. for <foreign lang="greek">a)nastrofh/,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">an inversion</hi> of words (like mecum, secum, quibus de rebus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reverso: <entryFree id="n41580" type="main" key="re^verso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕverso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn round</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">versa et reversa in tergum et in latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis qui non reversatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,036:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Os. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subcinericius panis est cinere coctus et reversatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: reversatur ejus ex talis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> reversatus, <hi rend="ital">turned back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebra ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reversus: <entryFree id="n41581" type="main" key="re^versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revertor.</entryFree>
reverticulum: <entryFree id="n41582" type="main" key="re^verti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvertĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>reverto</etym>, <sense id="n41582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 361, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reverto: <entryFree id="n41583" type="main" key="re^verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vort-</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vertor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vort-</orth>), <itype>versus</itype> (-vors-) (<sense id="n41583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. revertier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 14</bibl>), 3 (the authors of the ante-Aug. per. make the perfect forms, with the exception of the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> reversus, only from the active root, reverti, reverteram, revertisse, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 28</bibl>: <pb n="1590" /> <cb n="REVI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 31, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 11</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">reversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl> Dietsch; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf.: reversus sum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:17" default="NO">11, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:5:17" default="NO">4, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 2</bibl>. But in the present tenses the active form is rare: <cit><quote lang="la">revortit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1061</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1153" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1153</bibl>, and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 476, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or Com. Rel. p. 201 Rib.: revertebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 345 sq.; Zumpt, Gram. § 209 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) [verto], <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about; to come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (syn.: redeo, revenio). </sense><sense id="n41583.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitant me ut revertar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deiotarus) cum ex itinere revertisset ... persaepe revertit ex itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:26 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 26 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem (vultu) semper se vidisse exeuntem illum domo et revertentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita maestus rediit, ut retractus, non reversus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reversus ille, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) per propinquos rogata, ut rediret, non est reversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego a foro revortor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Fabricio ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Scythiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:6" default="NO">22, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverti ab exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 8</bibl>; for which <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad te revortar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi domum revorteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit> (opp. egredior); 70; 2, 3, 99; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl> (opp. egressi); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Formias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ameriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epheso Laodiceam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 25, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad assuetas sibi sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl> (opp. hinc profecti). — With double <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules praedā ingenti partā victores reverterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41583.2" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">sol inde (sc. a brumalibus flexibus) revortens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revertitur idem sol sub terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revertitur luna ad signum quodque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa videbis retro repulsa revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retroque a terrā cunctā revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis neget . . . Tiberim reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol reversus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 464</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41583.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41583.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit vox missa reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 390</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti jam limine ab ipso Ad vitam possint revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 961</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad superiorem consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illum animum meum pristinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad corporis commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad easdem particulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Musas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bonam vitae consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reverteretur in gratiam mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena in caput tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 340</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41583.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in speech (after a digression), <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revert</hi> to a theme, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribam tibi tres libros, ad quos revertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedo parumper a somniis, ad quae mox revertar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, ut ad propositum revertamur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad me revertar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illam puellam exposititiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ad id revertar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In a comic equivoque: revortor rursus denuo Carthaginem, Si quid mandare voltis aut curarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revestio: <entryFree id="n41584" type="main" key="re^vesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe again</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; trop., Dracont. Hexaëm. 1, 629.</sense></entryFree>
revibratio: <entryFree id="n41585" type="main" key="re^vi_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvī^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revibro</etym>, <sense id="n41585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reflection</hi> of light (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 4, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revibratus: <entryFree id="n41586" type="main" key="re^vi_^bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvī^brātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (only in <sense id="n41586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a reflection</hi> of light, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revibro: <entryFree id="n41587" type="main" key="re^vi_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vī^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n41587.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41587.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send back a reflection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa caeli contextio lucis fulgoribus revibravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 810</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revictio: <entryFree id="n41588" type="main" key="re^victi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revinco</etym>, <sense id="n41588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refuting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refutation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm Plat. 3, p. 31, 39</bibl>. <cb n="REVI" /></sense></entryFree>
revictus: <entryFree id="n41589" type="main" key="re^victus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revinco.</entryFree>
revideo: <entryFree id="n41590" type="main" key="re^vi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to see again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to see again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad eram revidebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. Act. Apos. 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revigesco: <entryFree id="n41591" type="hapax" key="re^vi^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĭgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to flourish again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revilesco: <entryFree id="n41592" type="hapax" key="re^vi_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become vile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus admota oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revimentum: <entryFree id="n41593" type="hapax" key="re^vi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n41593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lappet; an edging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fringe</hi> (syn. lacinia): (in oratione) omnia, ut in tenui veste, oris detexta et revimentis sint vincta, Fronto Laud. fumi (a little after, laciniam aliquam porrigat).</sense></entryFree>
revincibilis: <entryFree id="n41594" type="main" key="re^vinci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvincĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>revinco</etym>, <sense id="n41594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be disproved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuted</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">materiae iisdem litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
revincio: <entryFree id="n41595" type="main" key="re^vinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vincĭo</orth>, <itype>vinxi, vinctum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41595.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards; to bind around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi> (class.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n41595.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi esset (terra) caelo revincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancorae pro funibus ferreis catenis revinctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignis in contrariam partem revinctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes introrsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites demissi et ab infimo revincti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium (with religare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 212</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">zonam de poste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:379" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantem Mycono e celsā Gyaroque revinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: caput tortā angue, <hi rend="ital">bound around</hi>, Varr. Atacin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latus ense,</quote> <trans><tr>to gird</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 11: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Velleribus niveis et festā fronde revinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 459</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In a Greek construction: ecce manūs juvenem interea post terga revinctum trahebant,</quote> <trans><tr>with his hands tied behind him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui recitat lanā fauces et colla revinctus,</quote> <trans><tr>wrapped up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:41:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 41, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices in glaciem revincti,</quote> <trans><tr>bound</tr>, <tr>stiffened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41595.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sibi generum fraternā prole, id. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 36: miserā in peste revinctos confodiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:418" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 418</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:708" default="NO">4, 708</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n41595.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unbind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quempiam (opp. alligare, and = resolvere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revinco: <entryFree id="n41596" type="main" key="re^vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41596.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">victrices catervae Consiliis juvenis revictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">revicta conjuratio,</quote> <trans><tr>repressed</tr>, <tr>checked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia rerum aliquā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 410</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41596.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to convict; to refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disprove</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: convinco, refuto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 488</bibl></cit>: numquam hic neque suo neque amicorum judicio revincetur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in mendacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in culpā et in maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina rebus revicta,</quote> <trans><tr>disproved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 26, 7</bibl></cit> (with confutare verbis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniis revinci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
revinctus: <entryFree id="n41597" type="main" key="re^vinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revincio.</entryFree>
revindico: <entryFree id="n41598" type="main" key="re^vindi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vindĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exact retribution from</hi> (late Lat.), Primas in Gal. Ad. c. 5.</sense></entryFree>
revireo: <entryFree id="n41599" type="main" key="re^vi^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be green again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be covered again with verdure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:113" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reviresco: <entryFree id="n41600" type="main" key="re^vi^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vĭresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow green again; to recover its verdure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41600.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laesae silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor Ruminalis in novos fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepe revirescit decedente lunā, contra autem inarescit adulescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41600.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of an old man, <hi rend="ital">to become young again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes est virginibus subjecta, Arte suum parili revirescere posse parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars credunt torvos patriā revirescere vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41600.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow strong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous again; to grow young again; to be renewed; to flourish again; to revive</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando rei publicae vires, quae malitiā nocentum exaruerunt, virtute optimatium revirescent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam sunt accisae (res), tamen efferent se aliquando et ad renovandum bellum revirescent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl>: cum semel invasit senectus, regressum non habet, nec revirescere<cb n="REVO" />  aut repubescere potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>; Flor. prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Germanici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux pignore promissae laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:228" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc praeclari facti decus crebrā memoriā revirescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revisceratio: <entryFree id="n41601" type="main" key="re^visce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-viscĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoring of the flesh</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">revisceratio et respiratio ossium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revisio: <entryFree id="n41602" type="hapax" key="re^vi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revideo</etym>, <sense id="n41602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeing again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Ep. ad Sid. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revisito: <entryFree id="n41603" type="hapax" key="re^vi_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to visit again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revisit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem nundinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reviso: <entryFree id="n41604" type="main" key="re^vi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41604.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look back</hi> on a thing, <hi rend="ital">come back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">again to see</hi> (cf. respicio); <hi rend="ital">to pay a visit again</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad me revisas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 359</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ad lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reviso quid agant, aut quid captent consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde redit rabies eadem et furor ille revisit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>comes back</tr>, <tr>returns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1117</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41604.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to see again; to revisit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu modo nos revise aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum poteris, revises nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu velim ... nos aliquando revisas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 377</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa sedesque Revisit Laeta suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates tuus te reviset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem (with petere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1067" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1067</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Gallicanam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia sua cottidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">8: agrum saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—With things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">longos obitus (sidera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quae digna satis fortuna revisit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos aeterna revisens Fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 426</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revivificatus: <entryFree id="n41605" type="main" key="re^vi_vi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīvĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vivifico], <sense id="n41605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restored to life</hi> (eccl.
