Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revivisco: <entryFree id="n41606" type="main" key="re^vi_visco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīvisco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvīvesco</orth>; v. Orell. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl>), vixi, 3, <sense id="n41606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to life again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be restored to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revive</hi> (class.; a favorite word with Cic., esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n41606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reviviscat M'. Curius aut eorum aliquis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille reviviscet jam nunquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut revixisse aut renatum sibi quisque Scipionem imperatorem dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41606.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina, nisi manu eliguntur, revivescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avulsae pennae (insectorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 33, § 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41606.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew vigor</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa causa ea est, ut jam simul cum re publicā, necessario reviviscat atque recreetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes (civitatis) suis legibus et judiciis usae revixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventu nostro revivescunt justitia, abstinentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: quo facilius reviviscat Pompeianorum causa toties jugulata, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum venisset mandatum, peccatum revixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revivo: <entryFree id="n41607" type="main" key="re^vi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vīvo</orth>, no <sense id="n41607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to live again</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 477" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 563</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revocabilis: <entryFree id="n41608" type="main" key="re^vo^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>revoco</etym>, <sense id="n41608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be recalled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revocable</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">poenae leves et revocabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, with a negative, for <hi rend="ital">irrevocable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colus Parcarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 559" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen fatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 51: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis (sc. mortuus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:427" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non revocabile verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:291" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 291</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revocamen: <entryFree id="n41609" type="main" key="re^vo^ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recall</hi> (Ovidian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:561" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 561</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 596</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revocatio: <entryFree id="n41610" type="main" key="re^vo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recalling</hi> (rare but good prose). </sense><sense id="n41610.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a bello (with receptui signum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41610.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocationes lunae a sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41610.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatio ad contemplandas voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41610.4" n="2" level="3"> Ejusdem verbi crebrius positi quaedam distinctio et revocatio, i.e. <hi rend="ital">qualification and withdrawal</hi>, as a fig. of speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41610.5" n="3" level="3"> As law t. t., <hi rend="ital">the right of one absent from home to appeal to a court of his own state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 3, § 3</bibl> (cf. revoco, B. 2. c.). <pb n="1591" /> <cb n="REVO" /></sense></entryFree>
revocator: <entryFree id="n41611" type="main" key="re^vo^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>revoco</etym>, <sense id="n41611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recaller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum (magus),</quote> <trans><tr>one who restores to life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revocatorius: <entryFree id="n41612" type="main" key="re^vo^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for calling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revocatory</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏcātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. epistula), <hi rend="ital">a letter of recall</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revoco: <entryFree id="n41613" type="main" key="re^vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall</hi> (class. and freq., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n41613.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41613.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens foras ire volo, me retines, revocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de meo cursu rei publicae sum voce revocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatus de exsilio Camillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatum ex provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar in Italiam revocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes Campanae defectionis Samnites rursus ad Caudium revocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me intro revocas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus abiit: quin revocas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 19</bibl>: exclusit; revocat; <cit><quote lang="la">redeam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20</bibl>: abeo; <cit><quote lang="la">et revocas nono post mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 503</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetch back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn back</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina revocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidas manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficientem capillum a vertice,</quote> <trans><tr>to stroke back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:344" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus post terga,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 685" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscissam terram in liram,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring back</tr>, <tr>restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitibus revocantur ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>are pruned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B. 1. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidos artus in vivum calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 248</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41613.5" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41613.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To call back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall; to call off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi> soldiers from a march or from any enterprise: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus cognitis Caesar legiones equitatumque revocari atque itinere desistere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequentes nostros, ne longius prosequerentur, Sulla revocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae receptui canunt, ut eos etiam revocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius revocati proelio excesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos certo signo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 28: milites ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus crescens revocaverat fatigatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To recall to duty</hi> soldiers from a furlough: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ceteros conveteranos suos revocatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3580</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.8" n="(g)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to call back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Neptunus Tritona) jubet fluctus et flumina signo Jam revocare dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41613.9" n="b" level="4"> A theatrical t. t., <hi rend="ital">to call for the repetition of</hi> a speech, a vocal performance, etc., <hi rend="ital">to call back</hi> a player; <hi rend="ital">to encore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livius (Andronicus), cum saepius revocatus vocem obtudisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diphilus tragoedus revocatus aliquoties a populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties ego hunc (sc. Archiam) vidi magnum numerum versuum dicere ex tempore! quoties revocatum eandem rem dicere commutatis verbis atque sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatus praeco, iterum pronunciavit eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl></cit>.—Also with an inanim. object: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Orestem fabulam doceret Euripides, primos tres versus revocasse dicitur Socrates,</quote> <trans><tr>to have encored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:29:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 29, 63</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocasse et repeti coëgisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatim sum appellatus in Bruto Tullius qui libertatem civibus stabiliverat. Milies revocatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41613.10" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To recall</hi> from death, <hi rend="ital">bring back to life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā servetis revocatum a morte Dareta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 476</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Paeoniis revocatum herbis et amore Dianae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dysentericos a morte revocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 60, § 113</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41613.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to call back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resume; to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire; to regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover; to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away; to withhold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius sicut in vitibus revocantur ea, quae sese nimium profuderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are checked</tr>, <tr>pruned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: et vires et corpus amisi: sed si morbum depulero, facile illa revocabo, <hi rend="ital">will regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>,<cb n="REVO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (studia) remissa temporibus, longo intervallo intermissa revocavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, utcunque praetermissum, revocari non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (philosophia) nunc prope dimissa revocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquam duramque militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam exoleta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam animum incitatum revoco ipse et reflecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinolenti dubitant, haesitant, revocant se interdum,</quote> <trans><tr>recover themselves</tr>, <tr>bethink themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaedam contra naturam depravata restituerentur et corrigerentur ab naturā, cum se ipsa revocasset aut arte atque medicinā,</quote> <trans><tr>had recovered herself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocare se non poterat familiaritate implicatus,</quote> <trans><tr>could not withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae revocabo exordia pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:25:2 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 25, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocari in memoriam somnii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:8" default="NO">7, 1, 8</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: nec tamen illa suae revocatur parcere famae, <hi rend="ital">nor can she be induced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuaded</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam ad referendam gratiam admonitione revocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring</tr>, <tr>induce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:25:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: scalam nobis in memoriam revocare, Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 38, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Serm. 280:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. 280, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam rursus revocatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocat tua forma parentem (with recordor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:193" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni est ingenii revocare mentem a sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos ab illā consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:13:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 13, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (homines) spes praedandi studiumque bellandi ab agriculturā et cottidiano labore revocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam a cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a turpissimo consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a tanto scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ab irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:557" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam lapsos ab errore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritos animos a metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab errore ad rectiorem viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: cum ex saevis et perditis rebus ad meliorem statum fortuna revocatur, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptationem ab rege ad Romanos revocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus institutis ad humanitatem atque mansuetudinem revocavit animos hominum studiis bellandi jam immanes ac feros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam eos quasi formulam dicendi revocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quae me exempla revocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem paene ad manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad pristina studia revocavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad meum munus pensumque revocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad industriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 94, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se rursus ad moestitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicum ad rationem,</quote> <trans><tr>compel to an account</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinos ingratos revocavit in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae possessionesque omnium in dubium incertumque revocabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spem consulatūs in partem revocandam aspirare non auderet,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring over to his side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temporis hortorum aut villarum curae seponitur, in animum revocabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will transfer to my mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi, Quo blandae juvenum te revocant preces (= a me ad se vocant, Orell.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41613.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41613.14" n="a" level="4"> Pregn.: ad aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer</hi> a thing to something as a standard (syn. referre) (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">impuri cujusdam et ambitiosi et omnia ad suam potentiam revocantis esse sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiā movetur, si is, qui audit, adduci potest, ut illa, quae de altero deplorentur, ad suas res revocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad artem et ad praecepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa de urbis situ ad rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad illam rationem conjecturamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi> (not so till after the Aug. per.): si facta mihi revocare liceret. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 18, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem (shortly after: in servitutem retrahi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum ad quingenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41613.16" n="c" level="4"> As law t. t.: domum, domum suam revocare, <hi rend="ital">to appeal to a judge of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">city</hi>: <cb n="REVO" /> (legatis) revocandi domum suam jus datur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl>, §§ 3, 4, and 5.—</sense><sense id="n41613.17" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ask back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invite in return</hi>: mutuo vocare, Non. (rare): domum suam istum non fere quisquam vocabat. Nec mirum; <cit><quote lang="la">qui neque in urbe viveret neque revocaturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vulpem revocasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 25, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl>.—Hence, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis quoniam adhuc praesens certamen contentionemque fugerunt: nunc in meam contionem prodeant, et, quo provocati ad me venire noluerunt, revocati saltem revertantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>now that they are invited to come back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41613.18" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon anew</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque hominem populus revocat, et retrahatur necesse est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to answer a renewed accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4</bibl></cit> (6), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni de integro agere coeperunt revocaturosque se easdem tribus renuntiarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">refectum est convivium et rursus Quartilla ad bibendum revocavit,</quote> <trans><tr>challenged us again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivam in diem posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revolo: <entryFree id="n41614" type="main" key="re^vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly back</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n41614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdi quotannis in Italiam trans mare advolant et eodem revolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalus ceratis alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis ut nulla intro revolet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41614.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten back</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revolsus: <entryFree id="n41615" type="main" key="re^volsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvolsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revello, q. v.</entryFree>
revolubilis: <entryFree id="n41616" type="main" key="re^vo^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>revolvo</etym>, <sense id="n41616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be rolled back</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pondus (i. e. saxum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:193" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:237" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Nomin. Sept. Dier. 12</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">juro ego Fatorum nulli revolubile carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 51: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:476" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 476</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revolutio: <entryFree id="n41617" type="main" key="re^vo^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a revolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi> (late Lat. for conversio), Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:Trin. 12:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 12, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 922</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
revolutus: <entryFree id="n41618" type="main" key="re^vo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revolvo.</entryFree>
revolvo: <entryFree id="n41619" type="main" key="re^volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll back; to unroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwind; to revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (class.; esp. freq. since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n41619.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41619.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Draco revolvens Sese, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106: (pelagus) gelidum ab imo fluctum revolvit in partem superiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus (hibernus auster),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro Aestum (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 487" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro sua fila (Sorores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inmites scis nulla revolvere Parcas Stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:774" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 774</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 28, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pontus) aestu revoluta resorbens Saxa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from which the waves are rolled back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addiderat Civilis obliquam in Rhenum molem, cujus objectu revolutus amnis adjacentibus superfunderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus perplexum iter omne revolvens Fallacis silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>going over again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revoluta aequora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 660</bibl></cit> Wagn. — </sense><sense id="n41619.3" n="b" level="4"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, etc. (syn. revertor): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque revolvor identidem in Tusculanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter sese attollens cubitoque annixa levavit: Ter revoluta toro est,</quote> <trans><tr>fell back</tr>, <tr>sank back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissā jacuit revolutus harenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revoluta rursus eodem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 63</bibl></cit> (a little before: relapsa est).— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of returning time: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">centesimā revolvente se lunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula revolvuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phoen. 104</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41619.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to unroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. verso): tuas adversus te Origines revolvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium illud et scripta et lecta saepius revolvendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum loca jam recitata revolvimus irrevocati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:49" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:4" default="NO">11, 1, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41619.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41619.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis, quae denominata sunt, summa paupertas in eadem nos frequentissime revolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>leads back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: iterum revolvere casus Iliacos, <hi rend="ital">to go through again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undergo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">experience again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41619.7" n="b" level="4"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to return</hi> to any thing; with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eandem vitam te revolutum denuo Video esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 418" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in sollicitudinem revolutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: iterum in pejora revolvi,<pb n="1592" /> <cb n="REX" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:174" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus in veterem fato revoluta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 449</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia necessario a tempore atque homine ad communes rerum et generum summas revolventur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 31, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad patris revolvor sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ejus causae seposita argumenta revolvi nos oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 30, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illa elementa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dispensationem annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vana et totiens irrisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad memoriam conjugii et infantiam liberorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad irritum (labor et victoria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus ad superstitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.— With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum eodem revolveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, quo minime volt, revolvitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum majore periculo eodem revolvuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo revolvi rem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41619.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to relate again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat; to brood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego haec nequicquam ingrata revolvo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta factaque ejus secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:667" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 667</bibl></cit> (with secum jussa refert): <cit><quote lang="la">curas (animus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 764" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 764</bibl></cit> (with repetit metus).</sense></entryFree>
revomo: <entryFree id="n41620" type="main" key="re^vo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vomit forth again; to vomit up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgorge</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n41620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsos pectore fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumam avibus devoratis (dracones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 72, 92, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustum mare (Charybdis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 581" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 581</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:308" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 308</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the same: vorat haec raptas revomitque carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 731</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umorque aquae sursum revomit atque remittit (tigna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia assidue mota ventis maria revomebant,</quote> <trans><tr>cast up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at miseri fluctant revomentes aequora nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:326" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 326</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n41620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sanguine et spiritu male partam revomuere victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revorsio: <entryFree id="n41621" type="main" key="re^vorsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvorsĭo</orth>, v. reversio.</entryFree>
revorto: <entryFree id="n41622" type="main" key="re^vorto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvorto</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvortor</orth>, v. revert-,</entryFree>
revulsio: <entryFree id="n41623" type="main" key="re^vulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvulsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕvols-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>revello</etym>, <sense id="n41623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">unius schedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
revulsus: <entryFree id="n41624" type="main" key="re^vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of revello.</entryFree>
rex: <entryFree id="n41625" type="main" key="rex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rex</orth>, <itype>rēgis</itype> (<sense id="n41625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi> regerum, Gell. ap. Charis p. 40 P.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi> of a country, <hi rend="ital">a king.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41625.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis res publica, quae ut dixi populi res est, consilio quodam regenda est, ut diuturna sit. Id autem consilium aut uni tribuendum est aut delectis quibusdam, etc. Cum penes unum est omnium summa rerum, regem illum unum vocamus et regnum ejus rei publicae statum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 42, 65: simulatque se inflexit hic rex in dominatum injustiorem, fit continuo tyrannus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 49</bibl></cit>: rex Albai Longaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> p. 2691</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 34 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum sapientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex Ancus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anco regi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem deligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">20: reges, nam in terris nomen imperi id primum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regibus boni quam mali suspectiores sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges in ipsos imperium est Jovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romanam a principio reges habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post reges exactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.— A very odious name in the time of the Republic, i. q. <hi rend="ital">tyrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulso Tarquinio nomen regis audire non poterat (populus Romanus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nomen (sc. tyranni) Graeci regis injusti esse voluerunt: nostri quidem omnes reges vocitaverunt, qui soli in populos perpetuam potestatem haberent. Itaque et Spurius Cassius et M. Manlius et Spurius Maelius regnum occupare voluisse dicti sunt, et modo (Ti. Gracchus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 50</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex populi Romani,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cæsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem reges aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also regnum, regno, and dominus, with tetrarcha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl>; v. Fabri ad h. l.— In ancient Rome the king had also priestly dignities and duties; hence, after the kings were expelled, the name rex (like <foreign lang="greek">basileu/s</foreign>) continued to be given in relig. lang. to the priest who performed these duties; hence, rex sacrificulus, sacrificus, sacrorum; v. sacrificulus; and rex Nemorensis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">priest</hi> <cb n="RHAG" /> <hi rend="ital">of Diana Aricina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41625.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, as <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ruling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that rules</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum late regem belloque superbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41625.3" n="2" level="3"> <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n,</foreign> acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">basileu/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the king of Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 7</bibl> and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 1, 2 al.</bibl>; cf of <hi rend="ital">the king of the Parthi</hi>: regum rex (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">basileus basile/wn</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41625.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41625.5" n="1" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, as king of gods and men: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (sc. Jovem) unum omnium deorum et hominum regem esse omnes doctrinā expoliti consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: summi deum regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">divom pater atque hominum rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 648</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl> 2, 743 (with this cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o qui res hominumque deumque Aeternis regis imperiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 229</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Olympi magnus rex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 533</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 56</bibl>.—Sometimes also of other deities, as rulers of the realms assigned to them: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 606</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aequoreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:603" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrarum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 249</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:356" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex infernus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiae sortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 833" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui poli, mundique prioris,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Saturn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 62</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Æolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 52</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41625.6" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); of <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 544</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">575</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 55</bibl>; 7, 220; <cit><quote lang="la">of lions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the bull, as leader of the herd,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the queen-bee,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 106</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the eagle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 203</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Eridanus, as the first river of Italy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 482</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Phanæan wine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 98</bibl></cit> et saep.; also, of <hi rend="ital">the master</hi> of a feast, like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">basileu/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (sc. convivii), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 30</bibl> (cf. regnum and dominus); of a <hi rend="ital">governor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceptor</hi> of youth: <cit><quote lang="la">actae pueritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 8</bibl></cit>; of the <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king</hi> in children's games, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex inter ludentes delectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; of the <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patron</hi> of parasites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram rege suā de paupertate tacentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 136</bibl> et saep.; of <hi rend="ital">the son of a king</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chieftain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prince</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:174" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 174</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 7</bibl> Duk. (cf. regulus and regina); of <hi rend="ital">a powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fortunate person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive reges Sive inopes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regibus hic mos est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 434</bibl>. — Reges sometimes signifies <hi rend="ital">the king and queen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>, 27, 4; sometimes <hi rend="ital">the whole royal family</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 43, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, rex sometimes denotes <hi rend="ital">the character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentiments</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">feelings of a king</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex patrem (i.e. paternum animum) vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rege pater est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 187</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41626" type="main" key="Rex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rex</orth>, <itype>rēgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Marcia, e. g. Q. Marcius Rex, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 686, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. (Marcius) Rex,</quote> <trans><tr>brotherin-law of Clodius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit> (in a lusus verbb. with rex, <hi rend="ital">a tyrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despot</hi>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Marcius Rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 1 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rha: <entryFree id="n41627" type="main" key="Rha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rha</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ra=,</foreign> <sense id="n41627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Wolga</hi>, on whose banks grew the radix pontica, Rha ponticum, <hi rend="ital">rhubarb</hi> (Rheum Rhaponticum, Linn.), which thence received its name, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 28</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
rhabdos: <entryFree id="n41628" type="greek" key="rhabdo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhabdŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/bdos</foreign> (a rod), <sense id="n41628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of meteor</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 64, 14.</sense></entryFree>
rhacoma: <entryFree id="n41629" type="main" key="rhaco^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhacŏma</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhecŏma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a root</hi>, perh. i. q. rha, <hi rend="ital">rhubarb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhacotes: <entryFree id="n41630" type="main" key="Rhaco_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhacōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhacōtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient name of the site of Alexandria in Egypt</hi>, form Rhacotes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Rhacotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rhadamanthus: <entryFree id="n41631" type="main" key="Rha^da^manthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhădămanthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(rada/manqos,</foreign> <sense id="n41631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Jupiter and Europa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Minos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a judge in the infernal regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 435</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">439</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 480</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhadamas: <entryFree id="n41632" type="main" key="Rha^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhădămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhaeti: <entryFree id="n41633" type="main" key="Rhaeti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhaeti, Rhaetĭa, Rhaetĭcus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhaetus</orth>, v. Raeti, etc.</entryFree>
rhagades: <entryFree id="n41634" type="greek" key="rha^ga^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhăgădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhăgădia</orth>, <cb n="RHET" /> <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(aga/des</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">r(aga/dia,</foreign> <sense id="n41634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sores</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaps</hi> on various parts of the body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 44, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl> 7 64. § 129; 24, 7, 23, § 39; 28. 6, 18, § 66 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
rhagion: <entryFree id="n41635" type="main" key="rha^gi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhăgĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/gion,</foreign> <sense id="n41635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small spider</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27</bibl>. § 86.</sense></entryFree>
rhamnenses: <entryFree id="n41636" type="main" key="Rhamnenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamnenses</orth>, v. Ramnes</entryFree>
rhamnos: <entryFree id="n41637" type="greek" key="rhamnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rhamnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/mnos,</foreign> <sense id="n41637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">buckthorn, Christ</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-thorn</hi>: Rhamnus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 76, § 124</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhamnus: <entryFree id="n41638" type="main" key="Rhamnu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamnūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ramnou=s,</foreign> <sense id="n41638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northernmost town of Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for an ancient temple of Themis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in later times for a statue of Nemesis</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ovriokastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 233</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n41638.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamnūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rhamnusian</hi> Rhamnusium se aiebat esse, <hi rend="ital">from Rhamnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiphon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Nemesis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 71</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called dea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 631</bibl></cit>; and simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamnūsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 406</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 9</bibl>; Stat S. 3, 5, 5. — </sense><sense id="n41638.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamnūsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Rhamnusian goddess</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Nemesis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 694</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhamses: <entryFree id="n41639" type="main" key="Rhamses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamses</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (or ae), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient and powerful king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl> (al. Ramises).</sense></entryFree>
rhanis: <entryFree id="n41640" type="main" key="Rha^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhănis</orth>, ĭdis. <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph in the train of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rhapeion: <entryFree id="n41641" type="main" key="rha^pe_i^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† rhăpēĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(aph/i+on,</foreign> <sense id="n41641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> leontopetaion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 72, § 96</bibl> (al. rhaphanidion).</sense></entryFree>
